All Reviews

  1. I have owned this sleep mask for a few years now. Initially, I only used it on the rare occasion that I had bad migraine, which for me, can cause severe sensitivity to light. I also use it whenever traveling as you never quite know how much light will shine through your hotel window. Most recently, I've tried to use it on nights that I wake up a lot. I must be a light sleeper and having the mask on my face just seems to help me stay asleep or go back to sleep quickly.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- It's stays on your face/head! I pull my hair in a ponytail and then wrap this around my face, securing with the velcro attached at the ends. You can adjust how you need to, but as long as it's reasonably secure, it doesn't slide off, which is a problem I've had with skimpier face masks with the skinny elastic band.<br /><br />- This is a quality product. It's well made and seems very durable.<br /><br />- The fabric fully covers your under eye area because of the cut above the nose on the mask. So it really does fit snuggly against your face and block out any light.<br /><br />Cons - I've only recently discovered this during a Texas spring where humidity runs high. I wake up kind of hot in this mask now that it's warming up outside, even if we have the a/c on. Maybe this company makes the same mask with a cooler fabric for warm months. I'm not sure...have not checked. I still use it and just remove it if I get too hot. But if you're using this regularly and need it for something like daytime sleeping, you might consider this.
  2. Best sleep I've had in a while
  3. This was one of the worst sleep masks I've ever had. It goes over your ears but the fabric that is inside as the filler, is LOUD. It crinkles all night, I mean ALL NIGHT... it does block out the sun, and is comfortable, but it constantly woke me up with the crinkling over my ears. I've thought of maybe sewing some flannel fabric on the inside to decrease the sound, maybe I'll do that when I pick up sewing :P haha
  4. They are fantastic, however they need to be a little longer in back.
  5. I have used many a sleep mask and this is one of the better ones. However, for the price I don't think it's a great value. My main complaint would be that it doesn't stay in place well. The satin fabric is nice but it's a bit slippery and the mask tends to slide around.
  6. I use it every night, i use it every time i nap. This has made my sleep better and makes me fall asleep faster. It's high quality and can withstand my night tumblings. I love this mask and recommend everyone who wants a good mask get this!

  8. Slides off your face. Doesn't fit snugly.
  9. I ordered three different sleep masks as a part of the research I am doing in sleep. The Sleep Master was my favorite of the three and was the one I took with me and used on a road trip from Kansas City to Los Angeles and back with my sister who uses a noisy CPAP. The mask is very effective in blocking out light but even with the earplugs, it didn't block out all of the sound. In fact, I heard vague sounds from without and less vague noise from my own breathing and the blood beating on my eardrum. Still, it made it easier for me to sleep under somewhat adverse conditions.
  10. Very warm when sleeping. Also , after a few washes, the stuffing starts to poke through the fabric, making it feel &#34;hairy&#34;.
  11. I had high hopes for this, as I work an occasional night and have trouble sleeping when there is light out. At first, I was hopeful that the design would be better than a mask I bought at the corner drug store. It wasn't. While the material is comfortable and I didn't feel like it got too hot, it tends to slip. Additionally, the nose is not well fitted, and tends to open up very large gaps, allowing lots of light in. Probably it could be improved, but would need a fair amount of work.<br /><br />I like the padding over the ears, and the mask as a whole is quite comfortable. Just doesn't perform as well as masks that cost less than half the price.

  42. This is probably the best sleeping mask on the market. The material is the best part. It's extremely soft and comfortable on your face.   43. When I get this mask adjusted so it blocks most \\"not all\\" of the light, it's puffy center is pressing on my eyes hard enough to make them hurt. I give this 0 stars.
  44. I've now used 3 different masks hoping for optimal comfort and light blockage. The Sleep Master was by far the most comfortable fit for me compared to the [[ASIN:B0027OUUFW Tempur-Pedic Sleep Mask]] and the [[ASIN:B000M3HEMC Mindfold Black out Sleeping Mask]] as long as I planned to keep my eyes closed. My goal for a sleep mask is to assist in catching 1-2 more hours of good sleep in the summer months when early morning light starts streaming in about 5 AM through a window in my bedroom that is nearly impossible to adequately drape without undo financial expense. Otherwise I am a relatively easy sleeper. I don't expect to wear the mask through the whole night -- just slip it on if I am sleeping lightly or not at all in those final hours. I am most interested if work-related issues cut my available sleep options down to only 4-5 hours and these are further hampered by summer light. Thus my experience may be different than those who routinely need a full 8-hour mask. I think that one of the most difficult issues in sleep masks is that having differently shaped faces is going to influence whether we are personlaly satisfied or disappointed -- particularly if the expectation is a total blackout of external light. Its hard to get something to fit well enough without being uncomfortable and intruding on sleep while still providing extreme \\"black out\\". Also, the longer we are exposed to low light, the more sensitive we will beocme to just a few stray photons. That said. This mask excelled for comfort as long as my eyes were closed. It was optimized for sleep and relies on closed eyes somewhat to minimize awareness of external light. It might shift a little with sidelying or leaning against an airline window but not markedly enough for me to interfere with nasal breathing or create sinus pressure. It might allow more light leakage after moving around some during sleep (particularly at the bottom and around the nose, but so far this has not been a major concern to me. If I planned to use it for meditation, I would need to adjust my expectations some -- it doesn't accomodate eyes open as well ss the Mindfold or Tempur-Pedic. However, its lighter weight and silkier feel against the skin are an advantage if one meditates with eyes closed. Thus willingness to make some adaptations might make it a favorite. For persons who wear a mask for other purposes, such as simulated experiences of visual impairment, for holotropic breathwork sessions, or a migraine phase with photosensitivity in which complete blackout might not be unnecessary, I think this model could work very nicely. SUMMARY What I liked best about the Sleep Master was a fairly moderate price, excellent comfort, and quite decent light blockage. Ordinarily I would also like the sound dampening feature of the retaining strap. This would likely be a plus for many other users. (But it becomes a bit of a hinderance for me on call nights, because I do want to hear my phone well...so on these nights I wear the Tempur-Pedic.) If 1/2 star rankings were permitted I would rank it as 4 and 1/2. I didn't rate it as a five-star product because I still wish that it was possible to have my eyes open without scrapping my eyelids, and a bit more light blockage. Unfortunately, none of the masks I tried were completely satisfying for comfort and blackout, despite being on the moderate to higher end of the price range for this type of product. I suspect it is inevitable that no single mask will optimally fit both men and women across all levels of fitness and facial contours. Making more customer-specific masks may be possible, but these could then be harder to sell by mail when understandably there is a no-return-if-used policy due to hygeine policies.
  45. I had seen this Sleep Mask for sale for several years now, but was unwilling to pay the price. Instead I bought cheaper masks; in airports, on eBay, etc. They were okay, but when I misplaced the last one, I went searching again and Sleep Master popped up. Thinking there must be something to it since it is a best seller, I took the risk. Well, to my complete surprise, the thing actually IS amazing. I have never slept this kind of sleep; deep and undisturbed. I am only sorry I didn't make this investment in myself years ago. Those other cheaper masks were actually the waste of money. This mask is sturdy AND washable...I think it will last--that is until I leave it in some hotel or airplane...But, it's worth the risk of needing to spend on a new one because it really IS the best!

  51. The mask does a good job in hiding light; however, there are two problems with it. First, due to the soft silky material, it is very noisy around the ears. Because of the design of the mask, the sides of it go over your ears. When you roll over or move around, you hear the \\"rustling\\" sound in your ear. It's very distracting and tough to get to sleep. The second problem is thst it gets very hot under this thing. When you do take it of, you have usually a fair amount of sweat built up underneath. It's because of the silky material up against ths skin. If you can deal with those two issues, this wask will work for you. I prefer to find one that does not cover over the ears and is not so hot underneath.
  52. Quality is great. Works well. Worth the money versus buying a cheaper mask. I'm very happy. Since starting to use this mask my sleep is improved. No light, this mask doesn't put pressure on my ears and it is easy to take off without undoing the velcro. It also holds its shape. Thank you so much.
  53. This mask has a nice smooth silky feel, it is slightly on the heavy side which can sometimes make it uncomfortable if you blink or squint while falling asleep. The fabric seems to get rougher and start pilling as use goes on which I do not like much. The thing I like about this mask is it is very big and covers the eyes a decent amount so not a lot of light can get through from your cheek level or upper forehead like a standard cheap mask would. I also like that it is big enough that it hasn't accidentally fallen behind my bed. The design needs some small improvements and then I would give it at least 4 stars. The major major thing I dislike about this mask is that the Velcro on the back is very thick and it makes a lump right on the back of the mask that is uncomfortable against my skull when I am trying to sleep on my back on a firm bed, the lump is bad enough - that sometimes I get annoyed with 'wearing' the mask - and instead unfasten the mask and just drape it over my eyes (which means if I turn over in my sleep the mask detaches completely. The other point (though not as annoying) which really bugs me is if you toss and turn in your sleep the mask tends to slip off very easily, the fabric has part to do with this, and the other factor at play here is most likely the fact that the mask has no hard form to it so the nose divider tends to easily slide off the bridge of your nose and you end up with the eye portion of the mask suddenly on the side of your head! The company should really make the following changes: slim down the back of the mask so it has less fabric and less thick Velcro / is softer; find a slightly lighter fabric which is more durable and does not start to pill after slight friction (i.e. if I accidentally rub the mask against the exposed brick wall near my bed), add some form of rigid structure to the nose bridge, perhaps add some form so there is less friction with your eye lids, consider adding some concave form to the area of fabric that overlaps with your check bone - this would help keep out a lot more light, if I try going to sleep when someone else in the room needs all the lights on - I still notice light leaking in from the cheek area - just enough to bug me and keep me from falling asleep fast. All in all I am disappointed with the mask, as I looked at the ample glowing reviews here before buying and had higher expectations.
  54. A+ product and seller. AMAZING SLEEP MASK! Helps me fall into a deep restful sleep, and works better than all other sleep mask I've ever tried.(the other mask would cover my eyes, but would slip and slide all during the night, and let flashes of light in, which made me wake up all during the night, getting roughly 3 1/2 hours sleep.   55. I absolutely LOVE this mask!! This is the 2nd one I've bought, I wore the first out. I bought the last one at least 2 years ago. It's such a comfortable mask and I can't sleep without it. I also love that it is made in the USA. Comes with red, white and blue ear plugs too.
  56. I found this product to work less effectively than a $3 sleep mask I bought at target. Here's why: This sleep mask has no elastic band to hold it in place. Rather it has two Velcro strips on the material which you wrap around your head and attach at the back. What this means is that once you put it on it cannot dynamically adjust to your head should it move slightly in the night. The result of this is the mask slips up or down your head it does not stay tight. Like most people I have a somewhat spherical head, it is biggest around at my ears and tappers off towards a dome at the top of my head. I put the mask on and go to sleep. If my movements in the night cause the mask to move up a little it it is now around a part of my head which is smaller and it quickly becomes loose and basically falls off. A simple redesign could alleviate this: On one of the two Velcro straps put a short elastic strap so that there is a little give. The second issue is that it is loud! There is material covering your ears. The intention of this material is to muffle noise, but the material moves against my ears as I roll around and I hear a loud noise from the fibers in the cloth rubbing against my ears. A simple change in the material could make this quieter. To resolve those two issues with the mask one has to wear the mask so tightly it can't possibly move. To wear it so tightly causes headaches and discomfort. Additionally if the mask is so tight it puts too much pressure on my upper nose that I can't breath properly. In my opinion one is better off to consider a different product.
  57. This is the best thing I have EVER bought for myself, LOVE it! Great seller too. I use this every single night. My husband uses his computer late and I don't see any light or hear any noise (He has sound off, but the keys or the mouse click is sounded out). I also like to sleep in on the weekends and it keeps my world dark until I am ready to wake up! I have used a sleep mask for a couple of years and decided to invest in a good quality one.   62. I have tried *many* sleep masks, and this is my favorite, with reservations.<br /><br />PROS:<br />* The mask is wide, and it is very effective at blocking out light.<br />* It also covers your ears, muffling sounds.<br />* The mask is silky - not grippy - against your face. (I've owned masks in the past that had a soft but grippy material in the inside, which bothered my eyebrows.)<br />* The mask is large and hard to misplace among my pillows.<br /><br />CONS:<br />* The silky material extends all the way around the mask, which means that it slips out of place several times a night.<br />* There is no elastic, and adjusting the mask to fit my head in a position that both blocked out the light and didn't immediately slip out of place was challenging, and I'm not sure I ever got it just right.<br /><br />I wish that the mask contained a wide elastic with velcro adjustment in the back. I think that would take this from being a great sleep mask, to nearly perfect.

It does seem to breathe well but I have not tried it yet in the hot summer Vegas nights.
  67. I've had one of these for four or five years. It's still in terrific shape, and still comfortable. The design is dirt-simple, but it works.
  68. The item works as intended, the only complaint that I have is that the velcro on the 2 straps should be reversed so that the velcro does not stick to pillows and such while sleeping. I turned the mask inside out and it doesn't have the sticky side facing out, but it doesn't fit as well that way. Otherwise good item.
  69. I can't sleep without complete darkness. As soon as the sun comes up, I'm up. This mask is light, but it blocks all the light. I have tried many mask, but this one is my favorite! It is pretty too:)
  70. I am a very light sleeper and the glow from the clock and other electronics drive me crazy. I have tried many sleep masks and most of them have elastic bands, which tend to get uncomfortable during the night. This mask is large, soft and does not cut off my circulation like the masks with elastic bands. It also keeps out the light if you adjust it properly. I have a more restful sleep wearing this mask. I love it.
  71. My wife loves these masks.
  72. I finally found a mask that I can sleep with. This is it. What a great product. I plan on getting a few and wearing them for years.
  73. From the description, you might expect that this mask incorporates sound dampening materials for the sound reduction claimed, but it does very little if any reduction in sound unless you use the earplugs included. Plugs can be uncomforable after a while. As for the claim that this mask can be worn with a CPAP, it can but then it leaks light as there is nothing like a soft wire between the materials for crimping the sleep mask around the CPAP mask near the nose. This is a problem even with the smaller \\"nose pilow\\" type of CPAP. A full mask CPAP can not be worn on top of the sleep mask because this breaks CPAP vacuum. Mask also slips around easily unless it is very tight. As other reviews mention, this places some pressure on the eyes which is a problem for those of us using CPAP which can be drying to the eyes, making them sensitive. This product is only very marginally useful for CPAP wearers; it can shield the eyes from some of the CPAP exit air, but mask does little then to prevent light from disturbing sleep.
  74. I love this sleep mask, it has the right amount of padding, the width is nice so there's no temple gouging of any kind, no pressure on the tops of the cheeks or on the ears, the velcro keeps it in place so I can switch sides as many times as I want and it stays in place, the long slits at the eyes fit nicely on the sides of my nose and overall it has a luxurious feel. The delivery was quick and I'm very happy with the product.
  75. I have severe insomnia (I'm prescribed ambien)and I think that the masks help a little. I know there are tons of rave reviews but I personally don't like this mask at all. This is not sound proof what so ever, being a wild sleeper, I toss and turn a lot in my sleep, I have yet to wake up once with this still on my head. It slips off way to easily, even when it's pretty snug. I've had better masks, including a $5.00 one here on amazon.
  76. The product does as it indicates, it muffles sounds and blocks light. It is comfortable to wear.   77. When I put this mask on, I felt extremely claustrophobic, because the mask wraps around the entire head, ears and all. I was unable to use this mask, and had to return it for a refund the next day. It DID block out the light, but I just couldn't overcome the sensation of putting my head inside a bag. Also, the mask was a little heavier than I thought it would be. I almost felt as if I was putting a weight on my head.<br /><br />In this company's defense though, when I called to return the mask, they couldn't have been nicer. They made it very easy for me to return it. They sounded genuinely sorry that their product didn't work for me, and they processed my return, and returned my money within 24 hours.<br /><br />I would definitely give the mask a failing grade (for me), but I would give their customer service an A. I would not hesitate to give this company my business in the future if they come out with another mask, with a different design.

I have a strong preference for this particular product for several reasons:<br /><br />1) It is super padded and well constructed (no flimsy material!)<br /><br />2) The foam section wraps around my entire head and covers my ears (very useful in muffling ambient noise)<br /><br />3) It's COMFORTABLE and it WORKS!!<br /><br />Yes, it is priced a bit on the high side, but you get what you pay for, plus the SleepMaster lasts FOREVER.   82. I ordered this sleep mask because my bedroom window faces east, so every morning, I was \\"blinded by the light\\". NO MORE! You can move the mask around on your face so that it blocks out all visible light, and the velcro closure makes it totally adjustable to the size of your head. It is comfortable no matter what position you sleep in. I have only had it a week or two and I almost can't sleep without it. The only slightly negative thing about it is sometimes it makes my head a little sweaty. Well worth the money! I highly recommend it.<br />Allison, Denver, CO
  83. What I Like:<br />I like the velcro adjustment in the back. There is a large range of size options and a lot of velcro material to keep it fastened. I also like how the mask goes over your ears instead of an elastic band that sits right where eyeglasses would and slowly saws into your skin. Going over the ears provides a slight noise muffling effect as well. Not as good as ear plugs but it helps keep ear plugs in place. I personally like a little pressure on my eyes and dislike the cupped shape of many other masks.<br /><br />What I don't Like:<br />This slides up and off my head while I sleep. It also is too loose along that critical area around your nose and upper cheeks and lets light in. Sliding up on my head only makes the problem worse. I think some of these have to do with the shape of my head and face but I think most of the problems could be solved changing the layout of the velcro closure in the back. It just needs to be moved down a little. I tried pulling the whole thing down further, but it puts pressure on my nose and reduces airflow. Also, this mask is fairly expensive.<br /><br />A trade-off:<br />I think velcro is a more secure and reliable fastening method compared to an elastic band and it has a lot of room for adjustability. All of this unfortunately makes it pretty loud when you try to adjust it which might disturb your partner.<br /><br />I'd give this 2.5 stars if the system would allow.
  84. Best sleep mask out there. Bottom line.
  85. Love it! Nice and big to block the light and super soft fabric :)
  86. I bought this mask and another more traditional mask at the same time. The other one would never stay on through the night with my tossing and turning. This Sleep Master stayed on very well, and I consider the sound dampening a plus. LIght inevitably creeps in at the bottom by my nose, so that part is not perfect. All in all, my guess is that this is one of the best masks for keeping out light while staying on your head with a lot of tossing and turning. But one of the main features of my mask has been it tendency to transfer a lot of black pigment onto the pillow and sheets, enough to ruin them with stains. I'm sure I sweat a bit under the mask, but not effusively. I've washed the mask twice in the washer, and it still transfers pigment. I have had to use a \\"guest pillow\\" without any pillow case so that I don't mind getting pigment all over the pillow. I haven't seen anyone else complain about this, so I'm stumped. I'm going to wash it a couple more times to see if that helps. If you buy this product, I recommend testing it out on a pillow case that you don't mind ruining.

  88. This is a great sleeping mask. I have tried more than one, and it's the best one I've tried so far. The fabric is quite thick and plush.<br /><br />IMPORTANT!!!   92. Works great, and yes I have tried most of the others. Loud places you may still need earplugs, but I can tell the difference with this on. * Very comfortable. * Unlike the more rigid sleep masks, this can be rolled up as easy as a sock for travel. Other reviewers have said this mask puts pressure on their eyes - um they either have huge alien bug eyes or they work for the competition that makes a big bra-looking cupped eye mask. I own that kind too, and I prefer this mask but then again I have normal sized human eyes. Only downside for me is that the mask covers enough of my head that it can get hot. Not often but in the summer I will sometimes wake to the covered area being hotter/sweaty. The material could I suppose be made to breathe a bit more as its a very soft silk like material. Overall very happy to own this and have not used any of the others after I bought this one. Would recommend.
  93. This is not a sleepmask as you have come to know them. This is basically a silk pillow that wraps around your head. There are no strings or cords. The thing attaches to itself with velcro.<br /><br />Certainly, no light is going to be getting to your eyes if you don this thing. It can also double for earplugs in a pinch since you can lower the wraps to go over your ear. It's washable, and feels like satin.<br /><br />The problem for me is that this thing makes my head hot. For the first few hours, everything's okay. But then the sheer thickness of the thing makes me break into a sweat, which soon wakes me up.<br /><br />This thing is worth its weight in gold when you're on a long flight, though. I don't know about ordinary sleeping.
  94. The big problem with this mask is that the part that wraps to the back, with the velcro, is very thick. It's as thick or thicker in the back, at the back of your head, as it is on the front. If you sleep on your back, this means you can feel a thick lump of fabric right on the back of your head. I sleep on my back, I was really surprised at how uncomfortable this mask was. I tried it for 2 nights to see if I could get used to it, but it didn't work out. I'm not sure why they wouldn't design it to be lower profile in the back -- very strange decision. I'm not sure how anyone could rate this mask very highly because of this flaw.

  109. As promised after trying this new mask for a few weeks I am writing a new review. First of all I would like to address the worst review of this mask which apparently people are marking helpful. The lady she got mold in her mask after 4 days of wear which made her allergies flare up. Absolute rubbish. She goes on about her favorite mask being closed cell foam or something like that and provides a link to it. I suspect she knows the seller of the other mask. I actually ordered the other mask she speaks of when I ordered the black version of this mask several years ago. It was no where near as good or comfortable as this mask. Secondly I also have allergies to mold and have never had a problem with this mask and the materials of the mask are clearly written on the card that came with the mask if she had bothered to look. There is no foam in it. The inside is cotton. The mask I had from a few years ago was the Black model which they no longer sell. The only real problem with that mask was that if you sweat the black could bleed a little on to the pillow case. I finally got around to reviewing the mask a few months ago and stated that was the only problem. At that time the owner of the company emailed me after reading my review and appologized to me for the problem. She said this was a probelm with their supplier and had switched to the blue material for this very reason and was sending me a new blue mask to replace it free of charge! Now that is good customer service since I had not even contacted the company with a problem. After trying out the blue mask for several weeks I can tell you that there is no longer a bleeding problem and I have no hesitation in giving this mask 5 stars. It is more confortable and blocks more light than any other mask I have tried. It is true that a very small amount of light may get in around the the bottom of the nose but I have never tried any mask that did not do that. It is very minimal with this mask however, better than theothers I have tried. Don't expect the sound muffling feature to be of much use. It will block about as much sound as pulling the blankets over your head. If you want to block sound use ear plugs. The free ones included with the mask are my personal favorite and I order them 200 at a time. (different manufacturer) Together this duo is unbeatable if you have to sleep during the daytime. I also black out my windows since I am a shift worker and have to often sleep during the day. The mask is also hand washable and I recommend you do wash it fairly regularly to avoid getting dust mites in it, just like you would with your sheets and pillow cases. I actually wash mine in the gentle cycle and have not had a problem. Just make sure you close the velcro strap first or that can fray the outside if left open. In conclusion I would say you really cannot go wrong with this mask. Great mask. Great customer service. What more can you ask for?

  132. I spend as many nights in hotels as I do in my own bed. Often, multiple LED's in the room along with the frequent bright lights outside the hotel window create a room that's too light to sleep. I tried every eye mask available and the Sleep Master Sleep Mask is the best. When I used the smaller or more contoured eye masks, light would get in and/or I'd wake up with red-eye because somehow the edge of the eye mask would end up between my eye-lids and would irritate my eyes during the night. Also, with the other types, the narrow elastic bands would irritate my ears or cause soreness around my ears by morning. The Sleep Master Sleep Mask is comfortable, with soft edges and no elastic so that there is no chance of eye or ear irritation. It's washable (instructions say hand wash but I've had no problem washing it in the washing machine on gentle in a mesh bag and then air drying it). The Velcro when closed low on the back of the head near the neck causes no \\"lump\\" to sleep on for back sleepers. Also, the company's customer service is above and beyond most vendors' efforts. They truly care about making sure customers are happy and bend over backward to rectify any problems.

  146. I read all the overwhelmingly positive reviews for this sleep mask however in my experience, the mask fell short.<br /><br />The pros:<br />- The size is nice and large to completely block out all light (unless it shifts... more on that below).<br />- The material is soft and smooth.<br />- The strap is actually part of the whole unit and easily adjustable with the velcro for a snug fit.<br /><br />Now for the cons:<br />- The eye area of the mask should be convex a little so when you tighten the mask down, the material doesn't press up against your eyelids.<br />- Because the material is SO smooth on the inside, if you shift around in your sleep, the mask will slide around your head. It would be better of at least the back part of the strap - the part that goes around the back of your head - were made of a courser material so that it didn't slip as much. Because of that, the mask is useless... the cutout for your nose will end up being on the side of your face and then light comes in.<br /><br />I would say that if you toss and turn throughout the night, then this is NOT the mask for you.<br /><br />I would recommend the [[ASIN:B0027OUUFW Tempur-Pedic Sleep Mask]] - the eye cups curve outward to take away the pressure on your eyes, the strap is a little more sturdy and the padding around the eyes conforms to your face. (Although I would recommend buying it from the Relax the Back local store - they sell it for around $30 and you can try one on.)

  151. This mask has several pros and cons. I recently lost it, and have decided to go back to the Tempur-Pedic mask, which I LOVE: http://www.amazon.com/Tempur-Pedic-Sleep-Mask/dp/B0027OUUFW/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8&s=hpc&qid=1295654367&sr=8-4. Pros: 1. It's large and blocks out light quite well. 2. It also blocks out a little sound, which is nice and comforting. 3. It doesn't bulge out and doesn't have any straps that could irritate your ears or prevent you from sleeping comfortably. Cons: 1. The edges of the mask around the nose were fraying (on the first night) just enough to make me think there was a hair near my nose. It was so bothersome, and I finally figured out it was the edges of the mask fraying slightly. Even after trimming the frays, it feels like there's someone bugging me with a feather as I'm trying to fall asleep - crazy making! 2. This mask is so smooth that it actually slips off in the night. It's difficult to get exactly the right tightness that doesn't put pressure on your entire head, but doesn't slip off from being too loose. Most mornings I woke up to find the mask was off. 3. It does keep your head quite warm, which I didn't mind. However, an unwanted side-effect is that your hair gets an indentation that is pretty annoying - even after a short nap. Ok, good luck! All in all, these masks DO help me sleep much better. I lost mine 2 nights ago and haven't been able to get a good night's sleep since. I'm going to order the Tempur-Pedic one again, though. It's my favorite so far.

  180. Then I had to find the right spot so my nose would poke through just right to be comfortable and yet not let in light. But never enough to wake me.<br /><br />Another great thing about the Sleep Master is that it's machine washable (hang dry).   181. I've used a sleep mask for years and it was beginning to fall apart, so I did some research and decided to try the Sleep Master mask. One of the drawbacks for most eye masks is that they have a narrow strap. I tend to sleep on my side, and without covering from a wide strap, the ear plugs can work their way loose. The only drawback for me is that the mask is flat over the eye area, which can cause a little too much eye pressure. If this had some kind of cupped design like other masks, I would give it 5 stars in a heartbeat. What I wound up doing was getting a cupped design eye mask and wearing it underneath this one. If you're sensitive to light and your partner reads at night while you're trying to sleep, you know how miserable it is. This product puts an end to misery. It blocks all light, is very soft and comfortable, and is totally adjustable. It also comes with a pair of earplugs that fit in my ears perfectly. Other earplugs I've tried have fallen out or have let sounds in. These don't do either one, and I no longer hear any unwelcome night noises. My victory over light and sound is complete, and I sleep really, really well.
  195. I travel a lot for work and prefer a completely dark room while I sleep. This is not always possible when trying to sleep during the day.   196. The mask is very comfortable, like a pillow. It blocks out all light if you wear it with the pressure over your eyes. This, however, will actually make your vision blurry when you wake up because of the continuous pressure on your eyes. I had to wear this mask a little higher on my face than usual, and a lot looser than usual. So it does let light in through the nose area because of that. It is good for people with sunken eyes because the pressure is distributed naturally on the brow. But for people like me with a shallow face, I would recommend wearing the mask very loosely or looking into a mask that has eye cavities.

It doesn't feel as good anymore, as if it's stretched out or something.<br /><br />2. This mask should've been contoured around the eyes. I have to be really careful when tightening this mask because I'll otherwise wake up with sore eyeballs, and as one reviewer mentioned, really tired as if I couldn't get REM sleep.<br /><br />I've degraded my rating down to a 3 star due to the two negatives previously mentioned. I've now had my mask for about a year.<br /><br />On a side note, if you're attempting to wear earphones while sleeping, and put on this mask, the strap isn't long enough. I would find some sort of velcro extension. That's how it works for me, but then again, I do have a big head.

  206. This mask is essentially a blindfold (imagine wrapping a folded towel around your head). The fabric slips on hair and is therefore prone to fall off during the night. I suspect a satin pillowcase would reduce friction between the mask and pillowcase and allow the mask to stay in place longer at night. Since buying this mask three months ago and finding it uncomfortable and annoying (falls off during the night), I purchased a Comfort Sleep Mask from Walgreens with cupped eye patches that is far more confortable, stays in place all night, and costs a quarter of what the Sleep Master sleep mask costs.

  266. I suffer from a severe sleep disorder and require a sleep mask each day/night I manage to sleep. I burn through them rather fast, and prefer to replace them rather than try to clean them, since I never get it right, and I don't like the detergent smell on the mask.<br /><br />This mask is almost the same price as the mask I like most (the brookstone foam eye mask), but I was interested in the smoother fabric rather than the plush fabric of the brookstone mask. In that sense, this mask is pretty good. The material used is good and quite comfortable. It's cool and nonabrasive. They did not spare materials either. It is a solid mask all the way around, which will in fact make the mask easier to wear since you won't feel the pressure of a thin band around your ears.<br /><br />The downsides, though, are that (1) the mask has no contour around the eyes, and (2) it does not completely block out the light. If you cannot stand feeling fabric pressed against your eyes, then this mask is definitely not for you. Likewise, if you want virtually all light blocked, so that you cannot tell if it is day or night, then you should look for a different mask. This mask does a decent job at blocking out the light, but it still leaves a small band of light along the bottom of the mask.<br /><br />An advantage I think this mask will have over the contoured masks is that those thick foam masks are ill-suited for stomach sleepers. It also does not conduct as much heat. So you won't as likely suffer from sweat on warm nights.<br /><br />I think if you don't mind the flat surface on your eyes, and you don't need to block out virtually all traces of light, then this mask is a pretty good choice. But if those are concerns, this mask, while decent, is not going to be worth the price.<br /><br />Lastly, I recommend to people who suffer from a very bad sleep disorder to also pick up a pair of sleep phones. This is a head band with thin speakers embedded inside it. You connect that to your iPod. Create a playlist of nature sounds, binaural tracks, sleep hypnoses, etc. Then wear an eye mask over the top of the sleep phones. This will block out light and disruptive sounds, basically decoupling you from the world.

  279. I have worked shift work my entire working life, sleeping half the time at night, half the time in the daytime.<br />And the key to sleeping in the daytime. Quiet. Cool. Dark.<br />Especially dark.<br />At night I can go to sleep with all the lights on but in the daytime I need total darkness and the only way to get that is a sleep mask.<br />So over the years I have tried many,many, looking for the perfect one.<br />This is not it.<br /><br />It is very big, going way up my forehead, which serves no purpose. Light leaks in at the bottom of a mask, around your nose and cheeks, not at the flat top of your forehead. So this is pointless.<br />The bottom part, around the nose and cheeks, is thin and does not lie flat. Is it just my big nose, or is the cut out just too small? I rather like the wide ...very wide band. It does not move at your roll over and such but is wider..and hotter..than needed.<br /><br />Most annoying perhaps is the fact that this mask is totally flat and if you have it tight enough to try and keep out light and will be tight to your eyes and very uncomfortable. there must be room for your eyes to blink without hitting the mask and this one fails totally on that.<br />And did I mention it is very expensive. $$$ for a piece of silky material, a little padding and a piece of velcro?<br />The claims to somehow muffle sounds is just not at all true. Believe me, I tested it. Sure, put in the pair of included ear plugs and that will work, but that is not that they claim. Ear plugs, which I can not wear, work with any eye shade. Nothig special about the ability of this one, super-wide band or not.

  289. I've used these for a few weeks and am generally satisfied and can recommend this sleep mask having used a few. Here are the pros and cons as I see them -<br /><br />Pros:<br />* Keeps 99% of light out - even in a bright room<br />* Feels comfortable on the face; Haven't had any problems with hurting ears or mold allergy as other reviewers reported<br />* Does help muffle external sounds, but doesn't not completely eliminate ambiant noises<br /><br />Cons:<br />* There is that nagging 1% of light that sneaks in from around the nose; unless you have your eyes open though I don't see how you'd know it was there - I only did for testing purposes.<br />* The mask is adjustable, but does need to be firm against the face to keep out the light - when tight it can press uncomfortably against the eyes; might be better if the area around the eyes were recessed somewhat to provide some clearance; it hasn't caused me to stop using it.<br />* This mask is huge! Prepare to be soundly laughed at by spouses, friends, etc. Even on a man's face it's quite large. Reminds me of my Floridian grandparents \\"old people shades\\". Still I don't mind sacrificing fashion for a good sleep - which is what I'm getting.<br /><br />If you're on the fence I'd go for it. I haven't regretted my purchase at all.

However, on the negative side I find the padding makes my head hot and sweaty. Also, a few years ago I had Lasik eye surgery and while I've used other, smaller profile lightweight masks without problems, I find I wake up with scratchy/blurry vision that lasts a few hours with this mask. I do not wear the mask too tightly and do not feel like it's pressing on my eyelids at all so I'm not sure what is causing the problem. Back to the dollar store mask for me!

  312. ...I really did. My fiance bought it for me b/c it gets such high reviews. I've been using it for about 6 months and over the last month, I've worn a cheap airplane sleep mask under it to try to help. Here are the problems I notice: - There are plastic panels sewn inside the mask (where each eye socket is). I think these are what are supposed to actually blocks the light, but since the panels are much smaller than the mask itself, they slide around. Mine are closer to the ears than the eye socket and there is no way to slide them back into place without opening than ripping the mask open and readjusting, then sewing it back into place.. So the mask doesn't block much light after the first few times of wearing it. - The mask lets in light from where it connects to the nose. - To keep it on, I have to have the velcro so tight that when sleeping on my side, I end up with pain on the ear that is on the pillow. - The silky material is stained from the moisture from my eyes (and even though I wash it, the stain does not go away). That's it! On to search for a new mask.

  321. I do night shifts every other month and having a good sleep mask for day sleeping is a must for me. It's very comfortable and blocks pretty much 98% of all light in my opinion. The only light enters from the nose area, but once you close your eyes it's not a problem.<br /><br />Fit around the nose: I have a normal size nose (similar to the woman on the picture) as in not wide or too narrow, and it does not bother me. Like I said, it doesn't form a perfect seal and a little bit of light comes through. However, once you close your eyes you'll be able to sleep comfortably even with the window curtains open.<br /><br />Eye pressure: People complaining about eye pressure need to lessen the straps a little. They aren't convex or dome shaped, but IMO, if you loosen the straps you'll find a comfortable fit.<br /><br />Quality of material: Silk like material that is very soft on the skin. The strap fit well around my head and ears. It stays cool on my face all throughout the day. After several wash sessions (washing machine and dryer), little treads started poking out. They can be very annoying, as it tickles your face. You'll need to cut them off. If I buy this mask again, I'll probably hand wash and air dry to avoid this problem of threads coming loose.<br /><br />Overall, I would recommend this mask to anyone that is looking for a good sleeping mask.

  335. If you are only interested in this item because it combines noise reduction with light reduction don't bother. The noise reduction offered is hardely noticable. The ears have the same amount of padding as the entire unit does. You have to keep taking it off and on and concentrate to notice any sound difference. The package itself includes ear plugs. There is not even enough noise reduction to quite someone lightly breathing next to you.<br /><br />This item does block out a lot if not all light. It is comfortable (the material is slick). It does seem durable. The closure is in the back and is velcro. It is slightly uncomfortable to lay on the velcro portion. There is no stretch or give to this mask so I find it more comfortable to have it slightly loose (too tight and your ears will feel like you've been wearing headphones for a while and your nose will feel restricted). I thought it would be warm but the material is breathable enough I've not noticed much temperature difference.<br /><br />I don't think I would have bought this item if I had one to sample first. For the price and claims I was expecting better noise reduction. Not enough to block out snoring but at least enough to block out a fan or light breathing. I am keeping it as it is comfortable, blocks out lots of light, and my partner snores enough that I usually have earplugs in anyway.

  337. I have no idea how others could like it. The smell of chemicals is so strong that I couldn't bear with it after 10 min. This is clearly a problem of the heavily chemical laden manufacturing process. The label says it is made in the US, but it makes me wonder. Certainly it looks and smells like Chinese made. In that case, this item probably would cost under $1 to manufacture and should have a retail price around $5. And if you ask me, I know what I'm talking about and I know how sub-substandard and polluted the Chinese manufacturing process is. It isn't a matter of Chinese's manufacturing ABILITY (you know they could put a man in space and make high-speed bullet trains that US currently can't); it's all about the standard, awareness and concept. But made in the US? Can you prove it? I would expect something better if it is made in the US. Did they even check the manufacturing process? How about a smell test first? Do they realize this is put over one's nose? Heavily chemical laden. If I try to like it, my nose can't. Other things about this product are okay. Not outstanding, but okay. Wearing is reasonably comfortable, although not superb. Light-blocking is fairly effective. It leaks light from the opening above the nose, but I wasn't expecting total darkness. The material is reasonably soft, but don't expect natural silky feeling. It is just artificial material that has a reasonable quality. I don't like its color, but that's subjective, and I don't rate it low for that reason. And finally, I expect that some will hate this review. But please, if you don't smell, don't fault others because they can (unless your job is to watch out for this product here). I don't tend to write harsh reviews.   349. I've used sleep masks for many years, some good, some not so good, but this one is, without hesitation, the most poorly designed sleep mask I've ever had the misfortune to own.<br /><br />The problems I've faced are:<br /><br />1) The rough side of the velcro that holds the mask closed faces your pillow, so if you do not have every last part of the velcro covered it will stick to your pillowcase if you lay on your back. When you go to move it \\"rips\\" off the pillowcase it has become stuck to. This noise will probably wake you up; if it doesn't the fact that the mask, which has become stuck to your pillowcase, twists on your head as you roll over and no longer keeps the light out as the nose cutout now resides on your temple will wake you up. I would imagine that only those people with small heads can have the velcro completely covered, if your head is normal or on the larger size, you'll have a significant amount of velcro showing and not only be awakened, but ruin your pillowcase, as this sleep mask has done mine.<br /><br />2) Because of its design, in order to keep the mask on the entire night as you sleep, you have to velcro it pretty tight to your head. I've had several masks that are like that and usually it's no big deal, but because of the poor design of this sleep mask, if I make it tight enough to not fall off or spin around my head it pushes against my eyes fairly hard and when I awake my vision is blurry for usually more than 30 minutes and my eyes hurt because of the pressure against them all night long.<br /><br />3) The assertion that the mask muffles noise is simply ridiculous. Unless you strap the mask so tight to your head that your eyeballs are being shoved backwards into your brain, you will notice absolutely no sound reduction. Even when you have the mask as tight as it will go, it still does not reduce noise in the least. This is a false assertion and was one of the main reasons I purchased this sleep mask, only to be very disappointed.<br /><br />4) Finally, the ridiculous assertion that this mask helps us \\"ladies\\" keep a lovely hairstyle as we sleep, is laughable. The direct quote from their website is this,<br /><br />\\"And, for you ladies, we've all heard the saying 'Nothing looks better on a woman than a good night's sleep.' Sleep Master actually keeps your hairstyle in place during sleep! Wake up, take off Sleep Master, and you are ready to go...No bedhead!\\"<br /><br />Sleep Master's assertion only holds true if flat on top, with a band of squished hair across the middle of your head, then flat at the bottom is a hairstyle which you covet. This sleep mask hardly helps you maintain your out-of-the-stylist's-chair hair style while you doze, like it asserts.<br /><br />Please give a great deal of thought before wasting your money on this sleep mask. My suggestion would be to stay with a more tried-and-true model, for this one is a complete fallacy from start to finish.ion that this mask helps us \\"ladies\\" keep a lovely hairstyle as we sleep, is laughable. The direct quote from their website is this, \\"And, for you ladies, we've all heard the saying 'Nothing looks better on a woman than a good night's sleep.' Sleep Master actually keeps your hairstyle in place during sleep! Wake up, take off Sleep Master, and you are ready to go...No bedhead!\\" Sleep Master's assertion only holds true if flat on top, with a band of squished hair across the middle of your head, then flat at the bottom is a hairstyle which you covet. This sleep mask hardly helps you maintain your out-of-the-stylist's-chair hair style while you doze, like it asserts. Please give a great deal of thought before wasting your money on this sleep mask. My suggestion would be to stay with a more tried-and-true model, for this one is a complete fallacy from start to finish.

  364. What I didn't realize when buying this was that it remains wide all the way around your head rather than narrowing at the ear and around the back. I also expect the nose opening to be a &#34;V&#34; split rather than just a vertical cut. The nose opening took a little getting used to, and I find it turns on my head more readily that other masks I've used. The turning may be due to there being no elastic band to keep it tight, and the smooth material it is all made of readily sliding on your skin and hair allowing it to turn. None of these are major complaints, just observations. Blocks light well if positioned properly. Blocks some sound too, and comes with additional ear plugs if you need/want them. Perhaps the best thing (for me) is that it fits my giant head (7 3/4 hat size - XXXL helmet).<br /><br />My one real complain would be that within a week the blue material began to discolor from oils from my skin and hair. I generally shower in the evening before bed after I work out, so I'm not generally oily/greasy on my skin and hair that time of night. Since I don't wear it in public, I guess I don't care that much, but it isn't the best looking. Were it black you'd never notice, so if the maker is reading this, switch colors!

  426. The Sleep Master sleep mask is one of the best sleep masks I have tried yet. It effectively blocks light, is very comfortable with only a little slipping due to the soft, silky material. The claims of noise reduction are a little overstated and the dye is leaving a black color on my pillow case! I have a small head and the velcro strap is as tight as it can adjust, so it would be helpful if there was a little more velcro for those of us of smaller sizes. Other than these little issues, the light blocking effect is GREAT! (And this really WAS my main concern, after all.)
  427. Great mask and fantastic buying experience! Working a 12-hour rotating shift is a lot easier when you're able to sleep during the day after being up all night. Thankfully as a result of the Sleep Master Mask, I'm now able to get my much needed rest even when the sun is up prior to having to go back to work. I'm very happy with the comfort, fit & finish, and over quality of this mask set. It does a wonderful job at blocking out ALL sunlight, as well as, attenuating most noises that would otherwise wake me up. With the soft earplugs in, I don't hear a peep!   433. I am a light sleeper and have been trying things for years. Pills, masks and earplugs. Of all the masks I have tried, I loved this mask best for many reasons. The best was that it comfortably covered my ears, instead of a thin strap going over the ears and putting pressure there all night. It is think and feels great on the face. Unfortunately I had an episode last week where I apparently opened my eye, while sleeping (not this product's fault) and my eyeball dried out and stuck to the fabric. It was extremely painful and caused a \\"fabric textured\\" abrasion on my cornea. An ophthalmologist appointment and two days of recovery, and I'm now back to 100% but have been told I can't sleep w this style of mask. I'm sad that I sleep w my eyes open because this is a great mask if you don't do that. I however, will need to wear a contoured mask from now on that protects my eyes better. So really this rating is a 5+ if you close your eyes while sleeping. For people like me, who might open an eye unconsciously, this mask will hurt you, quite literally, as it puts a gentle pressure against eye while sleeping. I liked hat, until my eyeball stuck to the fabric. Ouch! Wish they made a version of this one w contoured cups to protect eyes AND the thick comfortable head band. That would be exactly what I need.

  435. I love this mask! I was skeptical at first, since I had never seen a mask like this, but it was well worth the money. My husband sleeps with the TV on, and I can't stand any lights when I sleep. This mask blocks it all out, better than any other mask I've owned. It's soft and doesn't slip around too much.   437. I work shift work and for years I went through the effort to black out windows with visqueen and tape. What a pain. Now I just throw this on and sleep through the day without any problems!
  438. The mask does an excellent job of blocking out light, letting virtually no light leak under its corners on even the brightest day. It's comfortable as the fabric breaths very well, meaning it won't make your face sweet, and the mask feels soft and comfortable on the skin. Properly adjusted it also stays in place well without having to apply uncomfortable pressure. It also works whether you sleep on your back, side or stomach; even if you shift around as you sleep (as almost everyone does) the mask stays on with no constant adjustments needed. As is surrounds the ears as well, it blocks out some noise as well, but you'll still want to use earplugs in a noisy environment; luckily earplugs work nicely with this mask. With that combination, you'll have no trouble blocking out the outside world almost completely; today it took me ten minutes to notice my alarm had gone off...<br /><br />My only gripe would be that there's no concave indentation for the eyes, meaning the mask presses very lightly against the eyes. This felt slightly uncomfortable at first, but after a short period of adjustment, I've had no trouble getting through a full night's restful sleep with this mask. If this is a deal-breaker, you might want to look at other masks that might suit you better. But for the majority of people, I'd say this is definitely a very good mask that I'd wager will last quite a few years, and definitely worth a buy at this price point!
  439. The mask comes in a plastic pouch. I opened the pouch, touched the mask long enough to hold it up to my face (BTW, it does seem to block the light very well) and could taste the dye in the mask. No, my tongue never came into contact with the mask, it only contacted my hands and eye area.<br /><br />I would never be able to sleep with the mask on. The taste lingered for hours after just touching the mask for 30 seconds. This shows me that the dye gets into your body through your skin, and that can't be healthy. I did notice several reviewers who had the dye leak onto their pillow, so the dye seems to be a problem. It's too bad, the mask would work well if it weren't for the fabric it is made out of.
  440. After reading many of the reviews I'm thinking that maybe human heads and noses have a lot more variety than I realized. I've had two sleep masks before this. This is so much better than either it's ridiculous. 1. It's a lot larger than the average sleep mask. So there's a lot more room for casual movement without sudden flashes of light. I doubt any mask will keep all light out under every condition unless you are gluing it to you, especially for people who have big noses or a facial arrangement that puts the bridge of nose far out from from far-sides of eyes. But this does much, much better than both my others. Also there's a lot of extra strap room for me, but I just saw a review where a guy griped he had to sew on extra velcro. Boy he must have a head the size of a pumpkin! Some people do I guess. I have a fairly small head and it is quite a bit longer than the other 2 sleep masks I had, so I think it is well proportioned for this kind of product. 2. It's true the back-strap is nicely padded and large. If you wear it low (more toward base of skull) it's not a bulk problem but probably at the straight back of head, for people with very firm pillows, sleeping on their back, it certainly could be. For me, my hair was always getting stuck in the velcro of my other sleep masks which drives me nuts. This one the velcro is only 1/3 the width of the back of the mask so it keeps my hair out much better. Plus, you get it tightened 'just right' and you can pull it on and off and you don't have to use the velcro anymore. I like the padded wrap-around personally. 3. It's very soft. But really, most eye masks are soft. Like the other two I've had, there is a bit of adjustment period needed, because make it too loose and anything will turn/slip if you move enough (this far less than the others), but too tight and you wake up with your eyes gritty-red and blurry. This seems more forgiving than the others though. 4. This thing with the noise-blocking is so hilarious. Come on, this is just cloth with slight padding. It does wrap around your ears. This is mostly useful for helping keep earplugs IN. (Note that it comes with earplugs but anybody who really REALLY needs quiet should buy those individually for best quality.) Does it block sound? Ah, about as much as pulling a blanket over your head would block sound, which is to say, maybe some degree of distant ambient noise that doesn't matter much anyway, but not really at all for any acute or loud sounds. Wrapping around the ears is far more comfortable than the strappy-sort of eye masks I've had before that are chafing, irritating, move too much, and bug my ears, so I love that it covers my ears, but that has nothing to do with sound for me... if you need quiet don't depend on this for it. It's for eyes. Deal with the ears in some other way. I didn't count that as a selling point or I'd have made this 4 stars. I think it's just a side-effect of the design they found a positive marketing road for. 5. Many reviews mentioned color-bleeding but apparently they fixed that some time ago. Mine doesn't bleed color on my white cases. Another reviewer said his kept fraying excessively and immediately. I wonder what on earth could be on them or the pillow or head chemically or otherwise to cause this? since it happened to more than one mask with him -- I can only say that my mask is not so far fraying in any way. Another reviewer said if you have a big head the excess velcro sticking out 'sticks to the pillow.' I wonder if he has some old design, because on mine, the part that is exposed is the soft cotton side of the velcro, not the 'hooks' part. 6. As it is considered healthier to sleep in a cool room rather than a warm room and I don't live in a hot climate and have climate control, I haven't had it be 'hot' on me. If I were having hot flashes like one reviewer, well yes, then it would be hot, but come on, anything would be hot under those conditions, the mask is very nice but itcannot trump menopause. If you live in a really high humid climate and don't have climate control, then I would think a padded eyemask might not be the answer and maybe some kind of soft weave fabric against solid black plastic outside would be better for those situations. 7. Is it worth the money? Well it's worth it to me but that amount doesn't break me or anything. My buddy says he made his own eyemask out of an old t-shirt and it worked great, maybe the truly poor should try that. Sleeping well is worth a lot to me and so far this thing is really cool. I had given up on eyemasks for a variety of reasons until I was morosely shopping for yet another and found this one with all the reviews and thought I'd give it a try. I'm glad I did, and I would recommend it to others.

  541. First of all, the effect of this product on my sleeping was instant and amazing. I have never used a sleep mask before, so I was a little apprehensive about wearing one, particularly after reading some of the criticisms below. I tried the mask for an afternoon nap the day I got it. It felt mildly odd when I put it on for the first time, but it was very soft, comfortable, and adjustable, so I got used to it almost immediately. I had a great sleep that afternoon and have slept beautifully ever since. (Not the case before I started using the mask.) The mask really blocks out the light and the padding muffles sound well, but not completely. That's actually a plus to me, because it blocks out just enough sound to remove distractions, but no so much that I can't hear my husband, the alarm clock, etc. I suspect that if you used the earplugs that come with, you could really block out almost all sounds, if that's your goal. It's also easy to slide the mask up and on your forehead and back down onto your face; you don't have to completely remove it or re-Velcro it to temporarily look or move around during the night. Now, to the downsides. Because of the padding, the mask can get a little warm over the course of the night. However, in spite of being warm-natured and living in a warm climate (Texas), I don't find it at all uncomfortable. I don't even notice that it IS warm until I take it off--and suddenly my face feels cooler. So I'd agree with those reviewers who remarked on this point, but unless you are really, really warm-natured, this shouldn't be a dealbreaker. Also, I did notice some of the black rubbing off on the pillowcases. However, the black washed out completely and the problem also seemed to diminish after the first washing of the mask. (I cautiously hand washed the mask in Woolite and let it air dry and that seemed to work well.) I'm guessing this is a problem of fibers rubbing off while the mask is new, but even if it's not, the improvement in sleep is well worth this minor inconvenience. In short, if you're hesitating buying this product because of the problems noted in some of the other reviews, in my opinion the plusses far, far outweigh the minuses.

  553. The dye will stain your pillow, that's almost certain. It is a fairly comfortable sleep mask, but not optimal (if there is such a thing, short of a custom fit). I've seen other reviews as well that say a little bit of light will still show up from underneath. Yes, this is true, although I imagine it depends on your face. My theory is that a female face will better fit this mask because the more prominent forehead that males tend to have may push it out of whack and cause some opening towards the bottom. Also, if you move around a lot during the night, it won't stay perfectly in place. As far as the advertised sound blocking attributes, they're almost non-existent. You will need to put on silicone ear plugs to block out noise; either that or cut foam ones in half. It is a soft mask though.

  570. For me, this is generally quite a good sleep mask, and it fits snugly without being tight. Light is blocked well, although obviously sound is not. I use it while my wife watches TV in bed via a [[ASIN:B00BGGDVOO Roku 3]] (headphones attach to the remote), so all I need blocked is the light.<br /><br />My only concern, which is relatively minor, is that there is nothing keeping it off my eyelids, so there can be a very slight bit of pressure from the mask depending on how I position my head. It's not enough to stop me from falling asleep or staying asleep, but it is noticeable. Those with sensitivity issues might prefer a sleeping mask with more protection around the eyes.

Eventually threw it away. Update: I emailed the company re: the ink. They had a batch of masks improperly dyed and were getting similar complaints. They sent me another one, no charge, and I haven't had a problem since. Excellent customer service. My only regret was not having emailed them sooner.   630. Received this mask a few days ago and first thing I did was wash it out with a gentle soap. Do not use a fabric softener--I will explain later. It is pricey. Someone is making real money on this product. Used it last night for the first time. Took forever to dry. Will wrap in a towel to absorb most of the water then hang to dry next time.<br />It has a few design flaws in my opinion: There is a fair amount of stress in the nose area. It would have taken but a second to reinforce the nose curve with a few more stitches; the end of the Velcro strips nearest the end flaps should be tucked into the mask's seam and then stitched (persons with longish hair who move around a lot as they sleep will find the Velcro tangling their hair); the end seams of the mask should be stitched over better at each end; and, the material, while pretty, is a polyester satin, warm against the skin, can be noisy, snags easily and most important of all stains easily. If you have oily skin, sweat, use moisterizer or have on makeup while wearing the mask, you will see the mask soaking up all of the above like a sponge.<br />Regular shampoo, rather than washing soap, used once in a while will remove these stains. Using fabric softener, while making the mask smell good in the short-term, will make the mask more absorbant and \\"floppy.\\"<br />I am keeping my mask because I do not have time to look for something else. Flying out tonight on a \\"Red Eye\\". I did trace out the outline on a piece of cotton fabric and hand sewed it to the inside of the mask for now. Washing the liner will be better than continually washing the mask. I also redid the ends by tucking in the Velcro strips and resewing the end seams. Since I had thread on my needle, put a few stitches in the nose area. All told it took me about 15 minutes.<br />Would I recommend this mask to a friend? Not at this price.

I emailed them and they jumped on it immediately, no questions asked. They sent a replacement that was perfect and we had it in a couple of days. Then they CALLED to be sure we got it and were satisfied. They seem to be a family business and are doing it right. Highly recommended.
  665. --------The item shipped quickly and in good condition. I have been using it every night and it really has improved my sleep. The only complaint I have is that it works so well, sometimes it is hard to get up in the morning because it makes it easy to block out the world.--------
  666. I gave this blindfold as a gift to someone who uses a blindfold every night and also to go to sleep in a car. She likes the ear covering, she is grateful there are no metal obstructions, and she really likes the silky feel. She's gone thru a lot of other blindfolds before this, and says this is by far the best she has ever had.
  667. I'm living with roommates at the moment, and unfortunately, they either enjoy leaving the light on or the door open (there's no window in the room). There's not much there to block the light, so I was left out to dry. I saw the sleep mask on Amazon for the first time, and thought that I would give it a try. The sleep mask itself has no strap in the back, and instead secures itself via a velcro strap (did I spell that correctly? >< ). I found this convenient, as I found the elastic strap of my previous sleep mask to be rather uncomfortable. On top of that, the extra width of the strap allows you to cover your ears, which helps to muffle any outside ambience, even without the earplugs that are provided with the package. The Sleep Mask has improved my sleeping habits. I would recommend this product to others.

The material feels nice, but it's hard for me to find a balance between too tight and not letting light in/feeling like my eyes aren't \\"breathing\\"/there is just a lot of material touching my face, and too loose so that the mask comes off at night/light shines through when I move.. :/ I really wanted to love it and I wore it every night for a couple of weeks to give it a fair chance. One of them is cupped, but the material (foamy) is a bit harsh on my face and didn't keep light out so well around the nose.   749. \\"Excellent. Item as described. Easy to use. Stays in place. Also, partially blocks out sound for good nights sleep. Arrived on time. Would use this company again. Thanks.\\"<br /><br />The above is the sincere but \\"knee jerk\\" review I dashed out when contacted by Sleep Master. It is an incomplete review as I did not want to take more time. However, after posting, I had a chance to read what others were saying about this product - and about their criteria for a good sleep. The two biggest complaints were 1) eye areas not contoured enough and therefore interferes with REM sleep (eye movements during sleep) and 2) that this mask did not block sound very well. Like many of you, I am sensitive to light and noise and have tried many different sleep masks through the years (the worst being the cheap masks you get from airlines when on a long distance flight).<br /><br />The fact is that no single product can provide protection for REM sleep and block 100% of the light and noise. Therefore, I use the 'Sleep Master' in combination with two other products. I first put on a contoured sleep mask to achieve protection for REM sleep. I use the '[[ASIN:B000CCI4YU Dream Essentials Sweet Dreams Contoured Sleep Mask]]' but use whatever works best for you. I then put in place my ear plugs. I use the the '[[ASIN:B000R8Y1Y6 Hearos Ultimate Softness Series Ear Plugs]]' but again use any plugs that you prefer. Lastly, I wrap the 'Sleep Master Mask' around (over top of) the contoured mask and ear plugs. The 'Sleep Master' is great as the outer layer as it is smooth and flat. This is important to me as I turn from side to side when sleeping and tend to loose or dislodge most masks and ear plugs. Because the 'Sleep Master' fits over the fairly rigid 'Sweet Dreams Contoured Mask', I can pull it tight enough to stay securely put while not placing pressure directly upon my eyes and adversely effecting REM sleep. It also keeps me from losing my ear plugs. The 'Sleep Master' provides me an 'additional' layer for blocking both light and sound. This may sound cumbersome but once in place it is the most comfortable and effective solution I have found. Does this solution block 100% of light and sound. No. But then again nothing will. Occasionally, a very small speck of light may get through and sound is still barely detectable but very muted and seems far away (for those of you extremely light sleepers you may want to add a white noise machine to the mix). The bottom line is use what ever 'combination' works for you. For now, the 'Sleep Master' is the perfect and indispensable outer layer to my own solution and I recommend it highly. A comment to Sleep Master - If you could incorporate a more rigid contour mask into the inner layer of the Sleep Master Mask then this layered approach might be unnecessary.
  750. If not for the tip of a feather sticking out in the wrong place I would give this a 5 star all day.<br /><br />It is soft and covers enough to darken most any room. I really like it except for that darn feather.<br /><br />Better than anything else I tried and close to perfect. If the feather moves away I may update to 5 stars.
