  752. Kinda bulky and you don't really get full darkness because of its loose fit
  753. I am a picky, high-maintenance sleeper. The room has to be pitch black, all alarm clock lights and computer power indicator lights and smoke alarm indicator lights covered up, white noise via a fan, a very gentle breeze, and a room temperature of anywhere from 68-76 (depending on the time of year). Bought this sleep mask because I married a TV watcher, you know, the kind of girl who likes to fall asleep while watching TV. Anyway, the handful of times I've tried using this attempting to fall asleep with these outside distractions, I failed miserably. I either had to grin and bear it or throw a temper tantrum and upset my wife. I love her to death, but I really don't love sleeping masks. That being said, this is probably one of the better ones you can buy, provided you know how to fall asleep with a mask wrapped around your face. Maybe one day I will be an expert sleep mask sleeper guy, but until then, this thing doesn't really work for me. But at least it's soft and cushy on my face. Oh and one more thing, you can still see through the nose curvature, a tiny splinter of outside light still gets through even though it's very faint. If you're reading this and thinking I'm a little crazy, you may be right, but I honestly don't care.
  754. I have had this mask for about a year now and I still love it! I recently bought one for my son-in-law and he loves it too. It is light weight, adjustable, super comfortable and stays cool through out the night. I plan on getting more of them for gifts. The only problem I have with this mask is that, every time I use it, I sleep so hard I don't want to get out of bed.
  755. The mask was delivered a week before the expected date. So far it is a great sleep mask. No light leaks. Slight muffling of noises because of the way it is designed. No heavy pressure on the eyeballs. It works as described. Highly recommended.
  756. I assumed the large size of the mask would block the light better than my smaller ones but it doesn't really. I think it needs to be thicker and have a black terrycloth lining on the face side. The terrycloth would be cooler on my skin and also block more of the light and also produce a non-sliding surface as the mask does slide around on the skin.
  757. The material is very soft and breathable, easy to sleep with. The only problem I have is that my head is rather large and my nose sticks out just a little too much. I bought this to sleep during the day time as I was on night shift and it just doesn't seat correctly on my face and I still see light around my nose. If I push it down so the light doesn't come in, then it presses on my nose too hard to be comfortable.
  758. The mask is precisely as described and very functional. If you need a sleep mask and use one regularly, it makes sense to spend the extra money for a better, more comfortable fit. You pay more for this sleep mask, but it's better designed and more generous with the material.
  759. This is like my 5th sleep mask. All previous ones do not block the light completely and most are uncomfortable.<br /><br />This is the most comfortable mask I have ever tried and it blocks 98+% of the light - which is what I bought it for.<br /><br />There are some complaints that it is not sound proof. It comes with some ear plugs and you can buy better ones if you need that. The ad states &#34;The ear area is padded for sound muffling&#34; ... &#34;ELIMINATES LIGHT and REDUCES SOUND&#34;. I do not know of ANY sleep mask that will eliminate sound. I really wish they had left off the sound part of the ad. Yes, with the earplugs in it reduces sound (about as much as the earplugs do) and I imagine that if tested it would show that the number of decibels that reach the ear is reduced even with just the mask - just not really noticeable.
  760. Well designed and very comfortable. Very useful for sleeping in planes and in hotel rooms when changing time zones. Very comfortable for a quick power nap in office as well!
  761. Great Item, Blocks most light and is comfortable and exactly as described. I like that it covers my ears. I find hand washing it works fine. The size and length are perfect. The mask can get hot in summer without a fan on you, My only problem with it is the material frays ever so slightly that little threads tickle my face and i need to trim them off. Overall definitely worth it.
  762. I've used this every night since I received it. I can achieve total darkness with this sleep mask. It is very comfortable and silky soft.
  763. I have had years of sleep problems and tried several types of sleep mask products. For my birthday last year, I was given one of the Sleepmaster masks ...and it is AMAZING! So comfortable, so light, so flexible. Of all the sleep masks I've tried, it is by far the best in overall comfort, increased ability to fall asleep, a soft reduction of ambient noise and durability. I plan to give them for Christmas gifts to my friends.
  764. I bought this mask as a gift for my mother. She loves it! She says that it's very comfortable and not tight anywhere! She has to sleep during the day and wearing this mask has made it so much easier for her to fall asleep.
  765. I really like this mask. It is super soft and really shuts out the light. It was quite nice to receive the earplugs with it...I definitely slept longer and deeper with it, and that was with all the added stress of getting married and staying in a very noisy house. Would definitely purchase again. The only thing that is not perfect is that sometimes the overlapping velcro in the back makes it hard to sleep on your back, with a lump under your head, but I generally get used to that and it doesn't prevent sleep.
  766. Soft, can wear it all night long, and keeps the light out. The fabric around the nose area is shaped so it settles on your face so no light can get in.
  767. This may be the best product for some. Not for me tho. Too hot. Comes off. Giving it to a client. Oh well.
  768. really like it its not to tight but usually stays on, i have woke up with it off but i got to sleep and stayed asleep so that was ok with me. what i love is that it covers my ears....i used to sleep with one of my daughters stuffed animals on my head, laying on my side with the body on my ear the legs around my neck and the arms over my eyes! LOL This has take the place of the silly panda! ha love it!
  769. I spent quite a bit for this top of the line beauty, but consider the value of a great night's sleep! You will love this mask because it's so comfortable, soft, and silky. An<br />added attraction concerns the Velcro fastener in the back. What an ingenious idea. The size is just perfect because it<br />allows no light to filter through. My husband likes to sleep<br />with the light on so he doesn't stumble in the night. I couldn't sleep before so this was just perfect.
  770. I've tried about 5 different sleep masks, and this one is my hands-down favorite. I find it extremely comfortable. The large, enveloping size makes it effective at blocking out light, and, at least for me, much less likely to slide off or, say have a strap get caught in an uncomfortable position behind my ear (there are no straps with this one).<br /><br />The only caveat is that I don't think anyone should buy this for noise suppression. The effect is pretty subtle -- it's what you'd experience by yawning. I simply consider the slight muffling a nice bonus.
  771. This is an okay mask but I don't like that it blocks my ears. The silk does make it comfortable but I like my Bucky much better!
  772. This mask has a very silky feel, is padded and very comfortable. Its large size works very well in keeping out light. The Velcro closure in the back works so much better than the type with elastic bands. I am so pleased with this sleep mask that I ordered one to give as a gift.
  773. NOTE: I am changing my review from 2 stars to 4. I know, I'm surprised myself, too. My original review is below, but I've found over time that I've grown to like this mask. Specifically, I love the soft silkiness of the fabric, and I've settled on a not-too-tight but not-too-loose way of closing the velcro such that it doesn't push in on my eyes too much, yet still stays mostly in place, with just a bit of light coming through around the nose area. I still find it to be not possible to sleep on my back using this mask, so I've made a point to only sleep on my side when I wear it. This has not been as big of an issues as it at first seemed.<br /><br />---<br />This is a decent sleep mask, with some major flaws, and some serious over-hype.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- the material feels very nice<br />- it is thicker, and does a decent job blocking out light if worn tightly (though see below)<br />- it has velcro in the back, so you can adjust the tightness<br /><br />Cons:<br />- If you're a back sleeper, forget it - the velcro is so thick that it will feel bumpy on the back of your head; I've tried positioning the closure up higher on my head as well as lower, and it's just not comfortable<br />- The ear coverage does absolutely nothing for dampening sound - that's just marketing gibberish (which would still leave this a fine mask, if it weren't for the other issues)<br />- I found that in order to get the mask on tightly enough to fully block out light around my nose area I had to tighten the velcro to be quite snug. The problem with that is that the velcro itself is positioned exactly in the area where your eyes are. What that means is that in order to tighten the mask, the most pressure is applied directly to your eyes. I think this issues could be alleviated if they had two strips of velcro, one above and one below, so that the main tightening could be on other - less delicate - areas of the face. For me, if I tighten the mask enough to block out light, myeyes feel the pressure and my vision is blurry and uncomfortable by morning. Not good!<br />- The price just isn't justified - I had just as much eye coverage with none of the back-of-the-head velcro issues with masks less than half the price
  774. I was so disappointed with this item... I absolutely can see through the opening at my nose, it does not block out light from underneath. I wore this on an airplane, and this mask is not the nicest one either, I felt a little silly. The guy next to me had a regular mask, but not those free kinds you get on the airline, and I kept thinking his was superior to mine. Although when I purchased this I thought I would have the 'ultimate' mask, incomparable and best. Not at all...
  775. This is the best sleep mask I have ever had. It is so soft and doesn't apply any pressure on my eyes. Not only does it block out all of the light it goes over your ears and eliminates some of the sounds. The velcro closure is sturdy vs the elastic straps on most sleep masks. Once I put it on it stays in place.
  776. This thing is amazing. It's very soft and comfortable and doesn't interfere with my getting to sleep at all. My job requires me to sleep at odd times, and this thing makes it pitch dark at any time of day. I never leave home overnight without it!
  777. 3/5 stars. Above average.<br /><br />The top rated review here on amazon seems extremely defensive of this sleep mask and a bit cynical and patronizing towards people who this sleep mask clearly doesn't work for, a little odd and rude of them to be. The truth of the matter is is that a sleep mask is a very personal choice and depends on the shape of a persons head/nose and what may work for one may not work for another. In the same way a body soap may work for someone but that may also irritate another persons skin, it's a personal thing. In my review here I've tried to look at this from not just how it works for me but how it works for the broader spectrum of people. Please don't listen to reviews that slam people whose reviews differ from them.<br /><br />I am one who needs pitch black to sleep and as it has been shown it is much healthier to sleep in complete darkness a functional and comfortable sleep mask is ideal. Especially when rays of sunlight come through in the early morning.<br /><br />I came to amazon knowing they would have a wide selection and this one seemed to be the holy grail of sleep masks yet the reviews seem divided so I will try to hit on the important points.<br /><br />1. The mask is very wide which is important to block light out. However the nose slot may or may not fit someones nose. The photo showing the sleep mask on the woman fits her so perfectly in every way (nose, forehead, head size) it would be nice if everyone's face was so perfectly proportioned but that is not the case. For me this doesn't block out all the light but does block most and I haven't found one that blocks all light. Depending on how this fits your nose/forehead it may block out more or less light.<br /><br />2. The mask does not have an elastic but instead wraps around and overlaps and Velcros. It is wide all the way around and barely narrows at all (it does not narrow nearly as much as the second two photos seem to show), it is also padded all the way around. This makes for a very thick band at the back of your head. If you sleep on your back, like I do this may bother you. Even if you push the back of it down toward your neck it is still in the way. However it is very gentle against your head and unlike many elastic ones it does not hurt the top of your ears, it is also easier to adjust than most elastic ones. If you have a very very large head this may not fit you or wrap all the way around. I have a medium sized head and it fits me fine (and has about 6 inches of excess).<br /><br />3. The sleep mask is basically firm but gentle foam covered in satin. The foam is gentle against my eyes but I don't wrap it too tight (read on as to why this might be a problem). It is very soft and I have not had any problems with it bleeding in the laundry or on my pillow. I wash it on gentle cycle (in a lingerie bag) in cooler water and hang it to dry. You could hand wash it if you wanted but whatever you do don't put it in the dryer. The velcro has held up and the mask is durable and well made.<br /><br />4. I sleep in a cool environment and live in a generally non-humid climate and prefer to bundle up in blankets in the winter than crank the heat up. I also don't sweat easily and really need to be working out. I sleep with my head exposed but this sleep mask makes me sweat. Which really surprised me. Satin isn't breathable AT ALL. The sleep mask isn't breathable and is so wide covering so much of your face that it makes me sweat and I assume this may happen to others. I wish it was made out of some more breathable but the satin is very soft (read on).<br /><br />5. The satin is very slippery and as it is so wide all the way around and never narrows to hug your head the sleep masks moves everywhere when I sleep. I toss and turn in my sleep (which some people stay still) and the satin just slips and moves all over my head with nothing to prevent it. I have woken up with the back of it over my eyes or with it completely off my head on my pillow. If you try to tighten it enough to keep it from moving it will put pressure on your eyes which you may wake up with a headache and your eyes very irritated.<br /><br />6. The cost. The item is well made and not cheap or going to fall apart. It also isn't made in China but in the US. It will last a lifetime and washes up nicely. If the sleep mask works for you then it is worth the price for a goodnight sleep. If it doesn't then it is a waste of $25 but amazon is very good with returns. I recommend you wear it every day for at least three weeks before judging it to allow yourself to get used to it.<br /><br />On a side note this doesn't block sound. That is just silly. It's a sleep mask, invest in quality earplugs (try Hearos).<br /><br />Overall if you have a very very large head or differently shaped nose this may not work for you. If you sweat easily or sleep in a hot/humid environment this may not work for you. If you move around or toss and turn in your sleep this may not work for you. In the end it just comes down to what works for you. If you have tried other sleep masks and they are not working out then this may definitely be worth at least a try. If you have never had/worn a sleep mask before and are just starting out I would recommend you first try the basic banana shaped sleep mask and go from there. 3/5 stars. Definitely not a universal sleep mask.<br /><br />I would like to do a slight update. I was recently reading FAQs and other information on the companies own site and I have to clear up a few things for those who are reading that as well. If you buy this mask please do not replace it once a year, the company just wants your money and there is no reason to do that as it does not wear out like that. This item does not solve bed head in any way or \\"keep a ladies hair in place\\", due to the rubbing from the back of the mask your hair will probably look worse in the morning than it would without the mask. Lastly, but very importantly (please read) this mask does NOT reduce noise. In reading their website I am shocked at how much they put forward the noise reduction to the extent that they say it might be a safety concern that you can barely hear! This is laughable! Cloth covering part of your ear is not going to reduce noise at all. They even say \\"If you choose to use these ear plugs with Sleep Master, please be careful because you will not hear anything\\". This may be true but it would be entirely because of your choice of earplugs NOT the sleep mask. They also say wonderful things about the complementary ear plugs provided, the ear plugs provided are not great. As I mentioned earlier if you are looking for total sound blockage try Hearos.llow. If you try to tighten it enough to keep it from moving it will put pressure on your eyes which you may wake up with a headache and your eyes very irritated.<br /><br />6. The cost. The item is well made and not cheap or going to fall apart. It also isn't made in China but in the US. It will last a lifetime and washes up nicely. If the sleep mask works for you then it is worth the price for a goodnight sleep. If it doesn't then it is a waste of $25 but amazon is very good with returns. I recommend you wear it every day for at least three weeks before judging it to allow yourself to get used to it.<br /><br />On a side note this doesn't block sound. That is just silly. It's a sleep mask, invest in quality earplugs (try Hearos).<br /><br />Overall if you have a very very large head or differently shaped nose this may not work for you. If you sweat easily or sleep in a hot/humid environment this may not work for you. If you move around or toss and turn in your sleep this may not work for you. In the end it just comes down to what works for you. If you have tried other sleep masks and they are not working out then this may definitely be worth at least a try. If you have never had/worn a sleep mask before and are just starting out I would recommend you first try the basic banana shaped sleep mask and go from there. 3/5 stars. Definitely not a universal sleep mask.<br /><br />I would like to do a slight update. I was recently reading FAQs and other information on the companies own site and I have to clear up a few things for those who are reading that as well. If you buy this mask please do not replace it once a year, the company just wants your money and there is no reason to do that as it does not wear out like that. This item does not solve bed head in any way or \\"keep a ladies hair in place\\", due to the rubbing from the back of the mask your hair will probably look worse in the morning than it would without the mask. Lastly, but very importantly (please read) this mask does NOT reduce noise. In reading their website I am shocked at how much they put forward the noise reduction to the extent that they say it might be a safety concern that you can barely hear! This is laughable! Cloth covering part of your ear is not going to reduce noise at all. They even say \\"If you choose to use these ear plugs with Sleep Master, please be careful because you will not hear anything\\". This may be true but it would be entirely because of your choice of earplugs NOT the sleep mask. They also say wonderful things about the complementary ear plugs provided, the ear plugs provided are not great. As I mentioned earlier if you are looking for total sound blockage try Hearos.
  778. I found this mask very comfortable, as you can sleep in any position and it is soft and doesn't move around too much since it goes all around your head. If you want to close out the light more, you have to fasten it snugger, which isn't always the most comfortable. You must wear it a little looser so it doesn't rub up against your eyes. I found it comfortable to wear in the cool weather. But I live in Phoenix, AZ, and I have worn it in some warmer nights (even with AC, it still is warmer) and then it isn't quite as comfortable. Then I would wear another mask which is less enclosed. I agree with others that it doesn't do much to keep the sound out, even though it goes around your ears.

  786. This is a great eye mask with good coverage. It's thicker than most other sleep masks, so it really does the trick. The velcro seal is perfect and provides a good tight fit as opposed to the sleep masks with elastic straps which inevitably get stretched out. I highly recommend it.
  787. Very good product! Look forward to using it on my next flight.
  788. I've tried so many uncomfortable or ineffective sleep masks that when I found this one, it felt like love! Someone named Judy wrote on Amazon that they had \\"mold allergies\\" to this product. I'm SUCH an allergy person that I once considered having my sinuses surgically removed, and would have if someone who'd done that hadn't dissuaded me. Anyway, I can't believe Judy's experience wasn't a coincidence, because I, my son, and many other allergy sufferers love this mask.(I can tell if a house has mold in it within minutes because my throat and nasal passages seem to swell and my voice gets husky and I have to take benadryl and get out FAST. So I'm sure this mask does not have that problem.) It's expensive compared to the crummy ones, of course. But it feels lovely, and looks lovely, too. Great present, btw. I've given many to friends including allergy-sufferers like me. I give them as general presents, hostess gifts, stocking stuffers -- and as a gift to anyone I visit in a hospital. (Hospitals seem to specialize in keeping their patients awake.) Good luck, all my fellow poor sleepers and allergy sufferers. I hope you'll be helped by this mask,too.
  789. but others won't as it is too bulky The strap is bad too Any good sleep mask should have two thin straps
  790. I am a long-time user of this product. I just purchased another Sleep Master, as I lost my other one recently while traveling. I use it all the time, so my first night without it I couldn't sleep! It was as though something was missing!! The Company rushed another to me right away. I love the way this mask blocks the light and covers my ears at the same time. It even helps with the sounds of my hubby's snoring! It's so comfortable and soothing that it seems to be part of me while I sleep. I wear this on a bright sunny day and take a nap with no problem!! I also want other users to know that before I started using Sleep Master I had very dry eyes when I slept. I went to the optometrist and he prescribed ointments and eye drops, but they never helped. So, I ordered the Sleep Master sleep mask to see if that might help, and my dry eyes are a thing of the past! I never experienced that with other masks or sleep aids. This mask is special and somehow different from all the rest. I was so amazed and delighted that I told my optometrist about it so he could recommend the sleep mask to his other patients.
  791. This was a perfect gift for my wife. She loves it. I didn't realize that some people have eyelid coverings that are so thin that even the smallest amount of light can wake them up. This solved that problem.
  792. I have owned this mask for over 5 years. I bought one when I realized that I could not sleep while my husband was watching television (I'm a very picky sleeper). Through the years this mask has proven to be a lifesaver. There are many days that I wake up, peek out from under my mask and realize that it's broad daylight outside and I had no idea. Here's what I love about this mask: - It is soft and comfortable; once you get used to it you don't even realize it's on. - It doesn't mess up your hair too badly. - I like that it covers my ears too, it makes it more comfortable and blocks out some noise. - It has held up well. - The velcro makes it possible to get it on nice and tight. The only cons I can note are: - After awhile the \\"stuffing\\" seems to shift/thin a bit away from the front of the mask. - At times the fabric which is cut out on the nose will cut into my nose if I don't have it on \\"just right\\". I am in the process of ordering 5 more of these so I can be sure to have one in my travel bag, one at the Lake, and one at the office. I also plan to give one to my Mom. Don't hesitate to buy this!
  793. This is an awesome sleep mask and works very well for blocking light while being comfortable to wear.<br /><br />This would be a 5 star review if they didn’t use the deceptive words in the product review of “REDUCES SOUND”. While it’s probably technically true that a “some” sound is reduced, it’s not noticeable. Just think about it, this is a fabric over your ear, how much sound could be reduced?<br /><br />That aside, as a sleep mask to block light, this works beautifully. It’s comfortable to wear and easy to travel with. I do a lot of long haul international flights in business class and gave up using the eye shades in the amenity kits and use this mask 100% of the time.<br /><br />The cover does not remove for cleaning, but I placed mine in the washing machine on gentile and then hung dry and all is fine.<br /><br />I recommended this product 100%. I just wish the company would remove the claims of reducing sound.
  794. They eliminate the light very well but are extremely warm to wear.
  795. It blocks somewhat more light out than other blindfolds, but is still not completely dark. Also, it's also annoyingly confining around the ears.
  796. Well, I'm not quite sure what is revolutionary enough about this to patent. It's basically a thick padded bit of comfy fabric with some velcro on it. So sure, it keeps the light out, and I guess since it has to cover your ears some to get round your head then it does cut down a little on noise, but the net result is like having a thumping great nappy stuck on your head! It's thick, so it's noticeable when lying on it, and it keep sliding off while you're asleep. I laughed out loud when I opened it and found the little pack of ear-plugs - yep, they'd help keep things quiet too, I suppose. No question, if I'd been looking at this in a store, and able to handle it and try it before purchase, I would not bother. I hadn't invested my whole sense of well-being and happiness in this, so I won't say I'm disappointed, but I won't say it's worth the money. Frankly, I wouldn't pick this if it was free. One of those silly little masks they used to give you on airlines does the job just as well if not better.

  798. Works great as far as blocking light and sound. I give it a 3 because the mask is really slippery, because of the material. I wake up and it is completely off.
  799. The version I got is different than the picture. Instead of a wide strap in the back, the material continues all the way around and connects together using velcro. There's nothing wrong with this, except it mean the mask is extremely large and bulky. It stays on reasonably well, but not as well as some reviewers described. Anyway the ear coverage doesn't work as well to block sound as earplugs, so that aspect of the design did not turn out to be a good tradeoff for me.<br /><br />2.   804. Best sleep mask ever, at least for me. When adjusted properly, with the back down close to the base of your head, it completely blocks light, it is comfortable for extended periods while sleeping in any position, and it stays in place even when I roll around in my sleep. It is the only actual sleep mask I have found, as opposed to a nap mask. Yes, it's bulky, and for that reason I use a more compact mask for overnight flights. And yes, it covers your ears and sort of hugs your head. I find that soothing but others might find it constraining. It does contact your eyelids, but just very gently and not to the degree that it interferes with REM. So it might not be for everyone, but I really like this mask and use it in preference to all my others.
  805. I purchased one of these here on Amazon. It's a &#34;mediocre&#34; product at best. It either fits too tight or too loose. In addition to that it's relatively expensive for a piece of thinly stuffed fabric.   806. Really didn't block out lite completely
  807. I'm a physician who works about 20-25 night shifts per year. Restful sleep in a dark cool room during the daytime is crucial for me. I tried 2 sleep masks from Amazon: &#34;Dream Essentials Sweet Dreams Contoured Sleep Mask with Earplugs and Carry Pouch, Black by Dream Essentials&#34; (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000CCI4YU/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i01?ie=UTF8&psc=1) and &#34;Revolutionary, Patented SLEEP MASTER Sleep Mask by Sleep Master&#34; (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0015NZ6FK/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=1). I sleep on my side 90% of the time and flat on my back 10% of the time. During the day my bedroom is silent (I never used the included the ear plugs with both sleep masks), but light still seeps through the closed windows/shutter blinds.<br /><br />The Dream Essentials sleep mask is cheaper ($9.95), but I found it to be uncomfortable. This sleep mask easily shifted around my face while I was sleeping. The lower part of the mask would cut into my nose and face after wearing it less than 1 hour. The band that goes around the back of the head is thin and cheaply made, it also started cutting into my ears. The amount of light that seeped in under the bridge of the nose was a bit too much for me, but others might find it acceptable. The only positive was being able to open my eyes while wearing this sleep mask. The Dream Essentials sleep mask was returned to Amazon.<br /><br />The Sleep Master sleep mask costs more ($25.90), but it's money well spent on a comfortable sleep mask. This sleep mask is made of quality soft material and it did not shift around my face while sleeping. The amount of light that seeped in under the bridge of the nose was minimal (if at all), a huge plus since it created almost complete darkness. It's difficult to open your eyes while wearing this mask, not a problem for me, but a plus or minus for others. Given the thickness of this sleep mask, expect it to generate more heat than other sleep masks. I'm keeping the TheSleep Master sleep mask for now, but I'll update my review if anything negative arises.
  808. Great sleeping mask for sleeping in broad daylight.
  809. The most comfortable eye mask ever! This one stays put yet slides beautifully over pillowcases so that no matter what position you're in, it provides continued darkness.   813. I bought this to help me sleep when my son was born, since I had to return to work and my wife would be turning the lights on to breastfeed our son. For this purpose it was good. The sound being muffled just a tiny bit helped a little, but it is not significant. It did come with some earplugs though.<br /><br />Pros: Soft, feels good against skin, blacks out all light, no weird smells, very nice construction quality.<br /><br />Cons: Because the velcro attachment is in a direct line behind the head (even with the eyes), tightening it enough so it doesn't slip back and forth when I move my head on my pillow to get comfortable causes the front of the mask to feel tight against my eyes. The first night I used it this tight I felt very tired the next day as if I had only slept 2-3 hours instead of 7. After this, loosening it and dealing with it sliding around a bit while getting comfortable helped me feel more rested.<br /><br />If this mask had a recessed area for the eyes it would be an easy 5 stars, since I could then tighten it so it wouldn't slip on my head without feeling like my eyes were being pressed by the mask. I have thought that I might be able to glue some large plastic spoons where the eyes are or something, but I am not ready to ruin the mask for an experiment like that. Maybe someone else will find a better idea...

  818. I've tried all styles of sleepmasks -- those with raised eye sockets and those that fit flat across the eyes, and all had some kind of elastic band across the back to adjust to your head size. I even tried one that had little elastic bands to fit around your ears! None of these were satisfactory in that unless the elastic is tight, it'll slip and slide and that can prove uncomfortable. It will eventually stretch out of shape, anyway. In addition, the size of the mask, itself, is often too small.<br /><br />Many years ago I discovered that I could just lay a dark cloth across my eyes, and that \\"sort of\\" solved the problem. But then, I found this wrap-around sleep mask which, I believe, is the ultimate solution. The material is soft, easily washable and wraps comfortably around your head. You position it over your nose, then adjust the fit with convenient velcro fasteners in back. Once you have it like you want it, no amount of light \\"seeps\\" in. By comfortably blocking out light, you are pretty much ensured a good rest whether it's in bed, a chair or on a plane. I can't recommend this mask highly enough!

  853. FOLLOW-UP NOTE 4/7/12: I apologize for the length and details in this review which relates also to sleeping disorders instead of a review of the mask only. I realize this is more information than most of you need or want to know. I was hoping that adding this additional information of what we have done to treat this, for those who have sleeping disorders, that it might possibly be helpful to them. It is a serious condition that can have a terrible affect on one's body, mind and health. For those who don't want or need this information, please forgive me and just disregard. The mask works great! God bless!<br /><br />I bought this for my son as he has very serious sleeping disorders. Mostly circadian rh ythm problem. We have tried just about everything over the years. Dr. said best room temperature for sleeping is 68 degrees. We do that. In fact, I do that for myself too and it does make a difference.Sleeps some during the day so black out room. Unable to do that right now. (Thus sleeping mask is needed). Bought him a Tempurpedic mattress (this helped greatly and worth every penny. Also bought him the Tempurpedic pillows and he says he will never sleep with any other kind of pillow now, he loves them). We tried several of the cheaper copy cat kind but they were not the same, unfortunately. Dr. said, \\"make sure he has plenty of light during waking hours\\". Dr. prescribed a light machine but insurance wouldn't pay for it because in New Mexico, they say, we have plenty of light. Wrong. Not if lots of trees and one small window with northern exposure. Bought him machine for \\"white noise\\" rainfall, etc. If room is too quiet, it is difficult to sleep. That made big difference too. Sprays lavender (aromatherapy for relaxation) on his pillow. He takes Melatonin tablet at time to sleep. These help too. Whew, it's been a job! LIGHT is biggest remaining problem, other than sleeping with 4-5 toy poodles (which remains unchangeable), so I bought the mask. It was more expensive than most, but then it is a patented design and there is more to it. I bought 2 other masks, one for me. The other to put in freezer for sinus headaches. He tried them and the nose areas let in too much light as he has larger nose than me. This mask, he says, feels better, only lets a tiny bit of light in at bottom nose area. He likes it too because it covers his ears and gives him a \\"comfy\\" feeling and drowns out louder unwanted noise. He still sleeps with a pillow over his head which he has done since a child and he still will not stop it. I thought the mask would help him stop that but it hasn't so far. Also, I thought when it said the mask interior was cotton fabric I thought that meant the inside side was cotton. It is not . It is all a very soft satin, inside and outside. I guess they meant the interior inside the mask that plumps it up. No big deal though. he uses it and likes it and that is something!The first night he did the velcro too tight and his ears were sore the next day. He has fixed that problem by not attaching it so tightly. While it does not bother him too much that there is no space to keepthe mask from touching his eyes inside, it would bother me, thus, I chose a different, less expensive mask. I am wondering for 'fitful' sleepers if a fabric other than soft, slippery satin would be better to keep the mask in place with less movement and sliding down? Just a suggestion. The seamstress, designer in me talking. Being a young man of few words , and slow to get excited about many things, my young son says this mask is \\"adequate\\". That is a good review from him.

  881. okay so I bought this product because I am a college student who is looking to get a good sound free, light free, night of sleep. The students in my dorm tend to be loud and obnoxious at night and after many fitful nights of sleep the past couple of weeks, I decided it was time to go find a nice sleep mask. I searched several different masks but all of them seemed too flimsy and I had little faith in the masks themselves. When I came across the Sleep Master Sleep Mask it appealed to me very much. Built in noise muffling, soft breathable fabric, the complete and total absence of light, this mask had all the elements I was looking for in a promising looking sleep mask. As soon as I saw the price I was reluctant to buy it because, being a jobless college student, I don't have very much money. So I sat in front of my laptop for about 5 minutes weighing the pros and cons. I finally decided to just go ahead a buy it because this would be a potentially a good investment. When I opened the package and had a good look/feel of the item for the first time, I had no quarells with what I received. The fabric is soft and silky feeling and when I tried it on it blocked all the light from my eyes. That night I was so exited to go to sleep and finally have a good nights rest for the first time in weeks! After applying the mask and adjusting it around my head I laid down and attempted to sleep. The first thing I noticed was that the mask liked to slip and slide all over my face. It fell off several times during the night so I adjusted it a little tighter to fit my head more snug. I than began to get a headache because of the pressure on my head. Eventually I feel asleep but was later awaken by noise! I could hear everything as clear as if I had no sound muffling system or whatever over my ears. I quickly reached for the ear plugs that came with the mask and they instantly blocked out all the noise. So than I feel back asleep. When I woke up in the morning I was thrilled to take thismask off of my face. As I took the mask away from my eyes and looked around the room I noticed something strange. EVERYTHING WAS BLURRY! At first I though my eyes were just adjusting to the light, but an hour later everything was still blurry(so blurry I couldn't read the words on my laptop). I don't know if its because the mask makes your eyes dry or the pressure of the mask on your eyes caused your vision to be blurred, whatever the reason this mask rendered me temporarily blind! I tried it out the next night and had the same results as the night before. Headache, discomfort, pressure, and temporary blindness. I then for the first time ever, returned the mask to the sender. I got my money back so all is good, but I would not recommend this mask to anyone! I'm not really sure how this product has so many good reviews but it absolutly and utterly sucks! (the only reason I gave this product 2 stars is because I like the ear plugs, and the color/fabric on the mask)
  882. This is the second time i've purchased this mask. The last one i bought was about 2 years ago and had it till my dog ate it. This is unfortunate because the company decided to modify the mask a bit by making it small which would make you think that contouring your face would be better but it made things much worse. I don't know why in the world they did that because the manages to fall off my face during the night;every night! By making it smaller they've compromised the stability of the mask. You might think that i'm not making it tight enough but it doesn't make a difference...The old (larger) version sufficiently wrapped and stayed wrapped around your face all night. For this amount of money it should do that.. Still and all the fabric is still very comfortable and it still helps me fall asleep.
  883. I have never slept so comfortably in my life! This product puts you in total darkness (which I need - every little LED or ambient light irritates me), and has a nice snug satin feel. I sleep with earplugs since my husband snores, but the extra little coverage from the mask really makes a difference and helps muffle the sound even more. I almost bought one of the masks with little holes bored out so it doesn't put pressure on your eyes, but for me personally, I found the snug, satin feeling on my eyes comforting and pleasant.

  891. I sleep with my eyes open, yuck...I know....but I can't help it!! :( That means I have dry, itchy, hot achy eyes most of the time. I wake up with bloodshot, dry eyes and my first few blinks are extremely painful. I have tried many sleep masks, and thought I would give this one a try - hoping I could get rid of the small gap around my nose that all the others leave. ...not to mention I never wake up with them still on! The problem I have with these is....they won't stay put!! The material is soft and satiny, very cozy...they cover more of your face, which helps block out more light (or air, in my case) and they fit well...you can tighten or loosen as needed. ...but no matter what I did...one slight turn of my head and they slip or slide right off. I have even tightened them to the point of being uncomfortably tight....only to have them slip right off when I turned my head! Maybe a strip of no slip on the back will help?? I may try that...I really wanted to love these....but so far, I am disappointed!! :(

  901. Arrived quickly, nicely packaged. Very comfortable!<br /><br />I bought the mask for upcoming travel and tested it out at home first. It is very smooth and satiny which feels so comfortable and cozy. It blocked out all the light from street lamps, my neighbor's security light, and the clock radio on the bedstand. I was concerned that a mask might press too much on my eyes, but though it's tight enough to block light (you adjust the Velcro very easily for comfort), there's still plenty of space for air circulation and to blink your eyes. The opening over the nose is also so light and comfortable you don't realize the mask is anywhere near the nose.<br /><br />I also read in other reviews that the Velcro attachment on the back bothers some people. I'm a side sleeper, so wasn't concerned, but in the interest of a thorough review, I tried it out on my back and had no problem. I do use a memory foam pillow so maybe the surface a back sleeper is resting on would matter, but I was comfortable and for side sleepers it isn't even an issue. Nothing but smooth surface on the sides.<br /><br />Very happy I got this, as I can see it will help me get a better sleep at home as well as during travel.   915. This is the best sleep mask I've ever had.<br /><br />The one I used, before sticking with this one, was made of black neoprene which after three weeks of nightly use made my eyes swell and my face develop a rash, so for three more weeks I had an itchy, red, puffy facial problem, which as my son would say, was a bummer, Dude.<br /><br />I've been using the Sleep Master eye mask nightly, for the past two years or so, and it causes no problems. The coverage is terrific, it can be adjusted with Velcro strips in back, it keeps more light out than the neoprene one I had, which didn't cover enough, let light in from around my nose, and also fit too tight around my brow area.<br /><br />I let my husband borrow my SLEEP MASTER eye mask and use it when I am lying beside him reading in bed with a bedside lamp on and he has to get up early for work. When I turn out the light I nudge him and he gives it back to me. The nice thing about how the SLEEP MASTER is made is that my husband wearing it does not stretch it out and make it too big for me, which is because the material is not stretchy--you use the Velcro closure for tightening and loosening it. (Big Duh Here: I guess I should be generous and buy my husband his own mask.)<br /><br />This SLEEP MASTER eye mask does NOT block out noise--as some reviewer claimed--not for me, anyway; and it isn't made to block out noise--it's an EYE mask.<br /><br />For noise blocking, I use Howard Leight Max Lite uncorded ear plugs, bought in bulk (500 at a time) via a shop whose rear end rhymes with Hey!. I wear earplugs every night because my husband doesn't just snore, he snorts and chokes (he has sleep apnea), and otherwise makes disturbing sounds I can't identify and sure don't want to hear.<br /><br />The SLEEP MASTER, though not made of silk, has a silky feel, and that feels great against my skin. I'm sensitive to fabrics, textures, all sorts of things, and I love, even need, how with the SLEEP MASTER, I can roll over from lying on my back relaxing before sleep, to sleeping on each side, throughout the night, without being aware of the mask. (Aside from the allergic reaction I had to the neoprene eye mask, I was always aware of its fabric being a bit puffy, a bit scratchy, a bit too tight in places, and that's just too many bits.)<br /><br />In nearly two years, though it is of course stained, using it at the end of yoga sessions for the Corpse (or relaxation) Pose, and of course, every night for sleep, I have not had to wash it. The SLEEP MASTER is a paradox: it's delicate (that's why it feels so silky), so I wouldn't launder it, though others might try and succeed at it, but it's construction is tough enough to have lasted this long for me.<br /><br />There is everything soothing to me about The SLEEP MASTER, except the price which is a bit much, but I sleep so easily using it, and it lasts so long, that it's worth the price--and more--to me, though maybe I shouldn't admit that last part online where retailers or resellers might see. (Gee, you think...)<br /><br />~ Carolyn Elkinseach side, throughout the night, without being aware of the mask. (Aside from the allergic reaction I had to the neoprene eye mask, I was always aware of its fabric being a bit puffy, a bit scratchy, a bit too tight in places, and that's just too many bits.) In nearly two years, though it is of course stained, using it at the end of yoga sessions for the Corpse (or relaxation) Pose, and of course, every night for sleep, I have not had to wash it. The SLEEP MASTER is a paradox: it's delicate (that's why it feels so silky), so I wouldn't launder it, though others might try and succeed at it, but it's construction is tough enough to have lasted this long for me. There is everything soothing to me about The SLEEP MASTER, except the price which is a bit much, but I sleep so easily using it, and it lasts so long, that it's worth the price--and more--to me, though maybe I shouldn't admit that last part online where retailers or resellers might see. (Gee, you think...) ~ Carolyn Elkins

  984. With inadequate blinds, and a bedroom window facing east right near the bed, the sun was starting to burn my brain at my old apartment a few years back, making sleep all but impossible right after dawn. I also enjoy a good nap in the daytime from time to time, and it became quite clear to me that I needed a sleep mask of some sort. I did my research, and the sleep masks I was familiar with, those flimsy cheap things with the little straps, just wasn't going to cut it. Luckily, I found the Sleep Master. This thing is just as advertised, a mask that fits perfectly to the head, blocking out light, particularly at the nose area, that so many other masks fail to do. Instead of a strap, this thing has fabric all the way around, so it stays on your head while you sleep and contributes to reducing ambient noise. Mine also came with earplugs, but I don't use them. They're the foam sort, that conforms to fit your ears. The thing is very comfortable, I feel naked sleeping without it. I like the thing well enough that I'm buying another two today. Due to forgetfulness on my part, I've nearly lost mine a few times traveling, so I'm buying more so I can leave one behind at home, have one to travel with, and keep a third in my car. If you're looking for a sleep mask, this is the only sleep mask worth considering.
  985. it works better than i expected. i am going to order another one just like it.amazing useful product. thank you.

They emailed back: \\"As a gesture of appreciation and romance we are upgrading to 2nd Day, no charge.\\" A $[...] upgrade for free! So, it arrived on time and my wife was so surprised. She didn't realize how bad her other sleep mask was before she got this. It is so soft, hides the light very well (think black-out), and it covers your ears a bit to muffle distracting noises. She is a light sleeper and must have a dark room and a sound machine for naps and nighttime sleep. Now all she needs is this mask and her sound machine, even when the sunlight fills the bedroom.

  989. When I first bought this, I would have given it four stars. It blocks light very well. I didn't have the problem of light leaking in around the nose that some people have described. It's soft and comfortable, too. I would have removed a star only for the silly marketing, since it doesn't do some of the things it claims--it doesn't muffle noise any better than any other piece of cloth, and of course it doesn't keep styled hair in place (I have no idea what they were thinking with that one). Aside from the tangential claims, though, it was a fine mask which did what it was supposed to do--blocked light. Finally, I could sleep while my husband kept using his laptop. Now, having owned it a while, I've noticed a bigger problem. After I take it off, I have blurry vision for a while. I don't mean just a few minutes; I mean half an hour to an hour. It seems to last a smidgen longer each time. I would guess that this is from the mask pressing on my eyes. If I wore it more loosely, I might be spared the eye pressure, but enough light would leak in that there'd be little point in wearing it. I'll continue to use it, but I'm shopping for a better one.

This mask blocked the light for a few days but then the flaps at the nose got loose and it shifts in your sleep so then the light leaks in at the nose. It feels comfortable at my eyes also in my opinion. I think that is the tough thing about a mask because if it shuts out light it may be tight on your eyes. Good thing I like about the mask is that the material is comfortable to sleep in and it doesn't impede side sleeping as some other masks do. (I have been using this in the winter so not sure how it would work in hotter climates as other's have stated.) Also it covers your ears and muffles the sound somewhat without crunching your ears. If I were to redesign this I would put a flap overlapping at the nose so it doesn't leak light in. (I'm thinking about sewing a flap to take care of this problem since I like the mask otherwise.) Recommend it but don't expect it to totally block out the light if you are sleeping in a day lighted room.

The design is poor just like several other people mentioned and for what you're getting it's not worth the 20 something dollars. I would imagine the business model for this company is based on the one time purchase at a high price from naive consumers with no intention of any follow up business afterwards. Oh and other people have mentioned that most of the positive reviews are from people associated with the company in some way, after having bought the product and used it, I find that theory to be highly plausible. I had a friend who worked for a marketing company that paid him to write good reviews and post good comments about various products on different websites. My advice would be to take to the 20+ dollars you were going to spend on this item and offer to overpay for something you know is worth only about 5-10 dollars.

  1090. Where to begin?<br />Based on all the 5 star reviews, it seemed I couldn't go wrong with this mask. It even mentioned sound blocking, which would have been nice - if there were any!<br /><br />1. The slippery material makes it slide all over may face and soon pop totally off my head - every time!<br />2. The velcro fastener in the back creates an annoying lump, making it impossible to sleep on my back.<br />3. The polyester satin material lets heat build up and causes me to sweat, and irritates my ears (which are sensitive). It soon seems<br /> like wearing a piece of sandpaper! If I put my hair over my ears to keep them away from the fabric the mask slides around even<br /> more.<br />4. From perspiration, and any oil on my skin I suppose, it seems to release color from the cheap fabric, which looks like a black stain<br /> on my pillow.<br />5. There is no detectable sound reduction!<br /><br />6. Finally - and very important, Sleepmaster says their product is patented. While searching for sleep masks on Yahoo, I came across something called the 'Miracle Mask' (buymiraclemask.com). It looks exactly like the Sleepmaster, and even says it reduces sound. The biggest shock is, that they are selling them for only 2 for $10! (Of course you have to pay Xtra shipping) This means you can get 2 miracle masks for about $24! My question is: if the Sleepmaster is patented as they say, how are they permitting this other company to sell a product exactly like theirs for such a cheaper price? Second, are they just selling these under another name, and undercutting the price they charge me and their other Amazon customers? I thought Amazon had some rule against that.<br /><br />These are the reasons behind my 1 star rating for this product!

  1103. I bought this because I will start working nights as a nurse in a few weeks, and wanted to make sure I could sleep as well as possible in the daytime. First of all, these are very comfortable to sleep in. They are a very soft, almost silky material. They are broad across the face and sides and this helps block light even if some slipping occurs during sleep. The material is excellent at blocking light, though this is partly due to the wearer needing to keep their eyes closed when in use. It is pretty much impossible to open your eyes while wearing the mask, which I found disconcerting at first. Oddly, I now find it comforting.<br /><br />I am also a side sleeper, and am happy to say that this mask works quite well for me. Evidently, some masks are too bulky for us side sleepers, but this one is nice and trim so it's no problem. The wider sides don't do much to block out noise, though the mask does come with a pair of disposable ear plugs. The sides of this are also pretty long, so unless you have a huge noggin, it should fit.<br /><br />I balked at the price initially, but I can't complain so far. Hopefully it holds up over time.

First thing I noticed was that it was very comfortable. It wasn't something that felt like I had to adjust to wearing. It doesn't get hot or stuffy when wearing it during any sleep session under normal temperatures. Cover is 99%, you can notice a hairline breech of light from the bottom around the contours of the nose, so it may depend on the shape of your nose. However it's unnoticeable when you're sleeping, at least for me it wasn't. It does come with ear plugs if you need them, I've never had to use them so I can't comment on how well they work in comparison to other ear plugs or how they perform in addition to the covering.   1130. Soft, blacks out the light. But pushes down on my eyelashes.
  1131. I was expecting something great for my $25 sleep mask. Boy was I mistaken. I hate to give a laundry list of issues, but with this item, I can't help but do just that. So, here goes:<br />1) This mask doe *NOT* block out light. I repeat...it is *NOT* opaque! Lying in bed with the mask on, face towards the bed lamp on the other side of the bed, open my eyes, there is a distinct blue glow. And the bed lamp isn't very bright! So no. This mask will not give you cave darkness. Unlike every other mask I have ever used, this one does *NOT* block light<br />2) The stitching of the mask where it goes over the bridge of the nose is rough and irritating. If worn in a manner that is deemed comfortable, the stitching will rub against the bridge of your nose.<br />3) This is perhaps one of my biggest gripes. It creates too much pressure on your eyeballs. Sure, you can adjust the tightness by messing with the velcro closure. But if you make it too loose, it will slip off your head. If you make it too tight, the mask will push against your eyes. Even if you keep it loose, the mask will still push against your eyes. I believe this is a design flaw of the mask. If you look where the velcro strips are, you will notice that it is in line with where your eyes would be. This causes the mask to crease at that point and put undue pressure on your eyes. Unlike cheaper masks that have pockets to prevent the mask from touching your eyes, this more expensive mask does not.<br />4) It's huge! This is a plus as well as a minus. It's a plus because if the mask does slip a little, it will keep spears of light from getting through the edges. It's a minus because no matter how you sleep, movement of your head will cause the mask to slip. There is no avoiding it. This mask will *NOT* stay where you put it. And most likely, when you wake up the next morning, you will probably not be wearing the mask anymore.<br />4) I don't get why this is patented. Is it because it claims to reduce noise? Puh-leze! Really? Is that little strip of cloth in some way supposed to block sound? I don't feel that there is anything there other than the cloth material that is present in the rest of the sleep mask. It's not as if there are sound deadeners embedded in the sleep mask...foam cups or something...nope...it's just the cloth that extends over your ears..nothing more...there is nothing special about this...wrap a towel around your head and you will get a better sound deadener!<br />5) That material that covers the ears, in fact *AMPLIFIES* noise! The material that covers the ears is part of the sleep mask as a whole! So if you lie on your stomach and the front of the mask brushes your pillow, this sound is transferred in an amplified manner to the material that covers your ears and is considerably louder than if it didn't cover your ears at all. Same for if you sleep on your back. Any movement where the mask rubs against the pillow or blanket will transfer that noise in an amplified manner to your ears...It sounds like a record scratching it's so loud!<br /><br />What I did like about this thing is that it doesn't skimp on material. My biggest problem with sleep masks is that it makes it extremely dark behind the mask. Then when you move, an edge may open up and a spear of light will stab through into this darkness and in your dark adjusted eyes, cause undue pain. This sleep mask is so large, that it if very difficult for it to move so extremely so that it will allow spears of light in. Unfortunately, because it is not opaque, you cannot get &#34;cave darkness&#34; inside the mask. There will always be a blue glow that you can clearly see with your eyes open or closed when wearing the mask.<br /><br />This sleep mask makes a valiant attempt to solve a problem, but fails on all of them.<br />What it would take to be the perfect sleep mask?<br />1) eye cups. Keep the material off of my eyes<br />2) use elastic for the straps<br />3) allow the elastic to be adjustable not only for size but for where it is to be positioned on the actual sleep mask<br />4) Put some kind of closed-cell foam in the cloth section that covers the ears<br />5) make the material that covers the ears out of ultra suede of something similar that doesn't transfer sound so easily.<br />6) There is *NO* reason the stitching has to be on the edge of this thing...The stitching can be wrapped around and stitched to the front of the sleep mask. Yeah, it won't look as pretty, but this is not a beauty pageant, we're trying to get some sleep here!

  1152. Four previous sleep masks have been unsatisfactory. All of them left light come in from the bottom of the mask. The part over the nose pushed the mask away a little letting light in. Also the bands around the head loosened in time, so much so that the mask became unusable. The Sleep Master solves both of these problems. It has no \\"nosepiece\\" so it fits snugger to the face. It covers a larger area so that if the mask does move slightly (when turning over, etc.) it doen't let any light in. But one thing it is not is a sound suppresant. I am hard of hearing and still heard all sounds with the mask on. It was worth paying more for this one.
  1153. I got the product and loved it. I have the most annoying skylights right over my bed and in the winter the moon just shines in like a flashlight right on my face. However after a couple of weeks my pillow case developed the brown stain that everyone is referring to here. I also set the mask on a magazine one day when I got up and that same night when I went to bed, the brown had come out on the magazine cover but it was really oily looking. I don't know if it's the oils from the body/sweat interacting with something or what. Anyway, I found that by using a spot remover on the stains and a lot of non-chlorine bleach that after 2 washings the pillow case was as good as new (thankfully since they're the most wonderful Lands End flannel sheets!). I've also found that every week or other week I hand wash the mask per the directions along with the non-chlorine bleach and that pretty much mitigates the staining. Over all a great product as long as you know in advance to wash it frequently (which makes sense when you think about how much time it spends next to your body) and you're not a back sleeper. I find that on the rare occasion I sleep on my back (the Velcro enclosure is right behind the head) it gives me a nasty headache in the morning but that's maybe once a month. Despite all of this, I still wear it every night!!!

  1162. Although it does have a couple faults and is a bit overpriced, this mask is very comfortable. The over-the-ear straps do serve to muffle distant noises a bit, but it actually amplifies close-up noises that you otherwise wouldn't notice, such as your pillow or blanket rubbing against the mask. The nose cut-out also doesn't quite fit my nose, so there is some light leakage, but less than other masks I've used. Other masks either tend to be stiff and uncomfortable, or too small and flimsy. This one, however, is comfortable even for side or stomach sleeping - it's like having a satin pillow over your eyes. It tends to stay in place better than other masks, and even if it does get a bit crooked during sleep it's broad enough that it usually still gives adequate coverage.

It gives me total darkness (regardless of whether my husband has an iPad on right under my nose), and I love the fact that the velcro is inset so it doesn't get stuck in my hair.<br /><br />As other reviewers have stated, it doesn't block a ton of noise so you'll still need earplugs if you are used to wearing them.   1173. I have used sleep masks for many years. It is just one of my eccentricities. When my old one was sufficiently grotty, I came to Amazon for a new one.<br /><br />This one works, but it is not the best. Instead of something like Zorro's mask without the eyeholes, this is like a tiny blue satin cummerbund. Your nose goes in a little notch and Velcro fastens the whole thing behind your head. The packaging claims the thing covers your ears to dampen noise. More like it covers the tops of your ears for no real reason at all.<br /><br />Take it from one who knows, what you want in a sleep mask is the ability to open your eyes under the blindfold. If you cannot, the thing feels claustrophobic. This mask is too close to your eyelids, and you can feel the closeness. Further, the wrap-around style is warm (remarkable how much heat comes off your head).<br /><br />On the plus side, since this is basically just a flat strip, it does pack nicely in your carry-on.<br /><br />All in all, go with the more conventional design.

  1188. This sleep mask is pure gold for someone who works 8 p.m.-4 a.m. and needs to sleep during that pesky light coming in through the window. I've had 3 other sleep masks that fell apart within 1-3 months of use and didn't screen light nearly as well. The material of this is pleasantly cool and slick similar to silk with broad flaps that go around to the back of your head, where its secured by a velcro patch, allowing you to seat the mask as loosely or as firmly as your preference dictates. These broad flaps provide a unexpected extra to a sleep mask I hadn't considered before that I found myself very grateful for. They cover your ears, and while that isn't quite as much as a noise cancellation ear bud, it does dampen sharp sounds so they are not as jarring should they wake you, allowing you to return to sleep more readily. The product even comes included with a pair of disposable foam earplugs that further enhance this quality if you're in a noisy area that needs additional sound dampening.<br /><br />But the true king is the light blocking with the layering of the material being dense enough to completely block light provided you seat it properly on your face. I shave my head and yet this material breathes enough to where I do not wake with a 'sweat band' effect, nor does it slide off in my sleep even when I've used a looser fit. Finally this mask washes nicely in a delicate cycle without loosing any of its light blocking qualities, pleasant skin sensation, or firmness of fit.

  1200. The Sleep Master Sleep Mask is a step in the right direction for any light-sensitive sleepers, or those working night shifts and need to sleep during the day. If you've ever used blackout curtains, they're great at making your room a blacked-out cave, perfect for resting regardless of what's happening outside. Sleep Master has taken the concept of blackout curtains and made it so much more reasonable, easy to install, and supremely portable! This mask is the logical step back from the curtains, as you simply place it over you eyes for the same result. Curtains have to be set up, dusted, and maintained. This is a simple mask that you can take anywhere and use whenever you might need to - it's a logical evolution of the same idea behind the curtains. They even went one step further and included a set of earplugs to complete the package - giving you protection from interrupting light AND noise. Such a good system, and way safer than sleeping aid pills. If you're having trouble getting a good night's (or day's) sleep - try this first.

The first time I put it on, I was THRILLED at how well it fit and the complete darkness it offered. Unfortunately when I woke up in the morning, I had had a pretty severe allergic reaction to either the material, or a chemical on the material. Having had MANY sleep masks in the past, it never occurred to me I might ever had a reaction like this. My eyes were swollen almost completely shut, as well as my cheeks being swollen like crazy. Having spent $25 on it I was determined to be able to use it, so I ran it through the washing machine for the next 5 loads of laundry that I did, hoping to wash away whatever was causing the reaction. Sadly, I wore it again and had the exact same reaction. So disappointed I am unable to use it, and lost $25 in the process. Maybe it's just me and my own body's reaction, so I don't want to scare anyone away, but having worn sleep masks all my adult life, this is the first one I have ever been &#34;allergic&#34; to. :(

  1272. Invaluable, comfortable, I have two sleep masks in rotation so I don't go through the dreaded Linus' blanket separation anxiety when one is being carefully washed and drip-dried.<br /><br />I came late to eye shades / sleep masks. Up until 2 years ago, the only times I had worn a sleep mask were on transcontinental flights. I didn't like those occasional experiences of eye masks, found them uncomfortable, and only wore them on long-haul flights. THEN: giant street lights moved into our neighborhood and shined directly into our bedroom all night long, which had lots of windows. I had much trouble getting to sleep and then couldn't stay asleep. Remembering my airline kit, I retrieved a flimsy eye mask and WOW - slept through the night for the first time in weeks. I still didn't like the airline eye shade, so I went in search of alternatives, trying several brands and styles.<br /><br />The sleep master sleep mask is now my favorite for home and travel. I depend on it for a good night's sleep.<br /><br />What you may or may not like: it doesn't have the cups, or molded sections that leave your eyes untouched, but still in dark. The sleep master fits snugly against your eyes. While I get the idea that the bug-eyed masks leave your eyes free to move around in REM sleep or whatever, and that makes sense to me, I have no problems sleeping or dreaming with this mask. If you don't like something (even a comfortable something) against your eye/face, the sleep master might not be for you. Btw, I thought I would prefer the molded extruded eye mask, but this sleep master turns out to be my favorite.<br /><br />My only &#34;con&#34; is that if I'm trying to sleep in an overly warm environment, like no AC in summer or a hot plane, the mask is too much, feels sticky, too hot, simply because it is a nice big padded thing. Luckily, I'm mostly able to sleep in reasonably cool environs, even if that means turning on AC.<br /><br />Finally, because it covers my ears as well, it reducesnoise a little. Not like ear plugs, but a little, which is nice.
  1273. Seriously flawed design:<br /><br />(1) The slippery satiny material does not stay in place as you move during the night, no matter how tightly you attach the Velcro. So, there is no protection from light anymore.<br />(2) The coverage of the ears is totally useless and does not attenuate noise much at all.<br /><br />This is a very overpriced, very disappointing product of low design quality.

Also, it's great that the mask doesn't smush any sleep lines into my face so I wake up refreshed and gorgeous after I wear it.<br /><br />Also - to comment on some of the other reviews I've seen: I don't notice any pressure on my eyes at all when I'm wearing this mask. Also, I did feel the velcro on the back of my head when I slept on my back and it was annoying. My solution to this was to move the strap down about an inch. Problem solved - and the mask stayed in place just fine!!!<br /><br />Make these in pink and I'll get another one!!

  1287. I chose this mask because I wanted something that would block light, be comfortable over my face and ears, and have a non-stretch band that would have a long, useful life. The band is adjustable via velcro. The lack of elastic is what will give it a long life. The one comfort exception is where the band fastens: at the back of the skull. When I lay on my back, the thick band raises my head a little. The rise is especially noticeable when I'm snoozing in the recliner rather than against pillows that give and neutralize the problem. In the chair, I must turn my face to one side because the weight of my skull against the velcro becomes uncomfortable in a few minutes. I assume I would have the same problem on an airplane or other firm surface. This might not be a problem for a someone who never naps in a recliner or who is tall. I'm 5'3&#34; and my skull lays where the recliner's headrest crests. Bottom line, the sturdy band is the trade-off for flatter but less-durable elastic. I wish I had found this mask when I was deployed in Afghanistan but better now than never. A mostly-comfortable, sturdy mask that fits and blocks the light is the thing. Quality sleep is precious everywhere!
  1288. It's very good quality. Made of satin material. My only complaint is the size. This this is huge. It wraps around your whole head and it's kind of thick.   1298. This sleep mask is very large and made of a nice silky material. I like that it has a velcro closure, because the elastic bands usually make my head hurt.   1299. Upon starting a swing shift job, I needed a sleep mask that was more reliable than the one I bought from our local drugstore. My sister got this one for me as a gift, with some guidance from me. Well, the *description* had everything I wanted. It's smooth/soft, thick enough to block light without too much weight, and can even dampen sound.<br /><br />It.Just.Doesn't.Fit.<br /><br />Looking back at the main picture, the sleep mask is stretched so tight across that woman's face that you can see pucker marks where her eyes would be. That's how tight it has to be in order to block light below the nose opening, since it's no more than a slit. This quickly causes terrible headaches & sinus pain, for me. In addition, I must have a weird-shaped head, because with zero elasticity, I can't keep this mask on for more than an hour. If it's positioned to actually block all light, then the velcro ends up being on the \\"widest\\" part of the back of my head, and it's only a matter of time before it slips down or up. I can fasten the velcro lower and it stays put...but then tons of light comes in by the nose slit.<br /><br />As for the guarantee advertised by the manufacturer, 30 days is not enough. As a gift, the time was up immediately. [*****EDIT: I assumed a return would be impossible, since the deadline had passed quite a while ago. In fact, when my sister contacted the company, they immediately worked with her and within a couple days I had shipped the old mask back and she received a full refund. Great customer service - adding an extra 2 stars since the \\"risk\\" is so low!*****]<br /><br />The material and filling truly are nice, but the design doesn't work for me.

  1301. My wife has gone through quite a few brands and styles of sleep masks, and she considers this model by far the most comfortable and effective. She only wishes that she had picked this model up first, rather than first going through the slightly cheaper and significantly less effective alternatives.<br /><br />The mask is large, yet not heavy, and fully blocks light, plus muffling sound, without being too thick. The smooth outer material means the user does not suffer from excessive warmth, as happens with some other masks. Likewise, the rear strap is comfortable, unlike many other models, and not disruptive for individuals who like to sleep on their backs.<br /><br />Significant secure adjustability results in ease of use for both myself, with a rather small head, and my wife, with a rather large head. This is truly an example of a product for which a slightly higher cost means significantly higher effectiveness and comfort. I highly and heartily recommend it!

A tad bulky for side sleep, it is great if you want to just sleep on your back.
  1303. I was looking forward to receiving this mask. I was very disappointed. First, while the ads do say works with a CPAP, my fit did NOT. Could not get the mask tight enuff on my face for a good seal. Also, secondly, the mask does not breath. Try wearing this on a normal, un air-conditioned night (for me in the desert, minimal humidity) . The sweat builds up, pours off, soaks the mask and makes breathing difficult. I would dread an un air conditioned nite in NY, WDC or Memphis. No thank you. After wearing it for a week or so. I returned it. I wouldn't use it again if the manufacturer gave me $25.00 to take it!
  1304. This was my first sleeping mask and for a steep $25, I was expecting it to change my life...<br /><br />It did. This mask cuts out 100% of light. and the earplugs cut out 90% of noise. my fiance works closing shifts at the movie theater sometimes and so there are occasions where she won't be home until 2AM. I always go to sleep at 11PM because I work mornings all the time. regardless of how long I've been asleep, her actions no longer wake me up. We share a small apartment and the computer is right next to the bed. and the bed is about 15 feet from the kitchen. my fiance is able to read email (and facebook, which I don't do), cook herself a snack, and shower and whatever before bed and none of that wakes me anymore.<br /><br />I woke up the other day not knowing what time it was, and I figured at first that it was about 5AM because it was so dark. I remembered I had the sleeping mask on and I took it off to check my watch. I was caught by surprise when I saw the sun was way up and it was 10AM already. This was one of the best purchases I've made from Amazon in at least 2 years.<br /><br />on a side note, the fabric is very soft. I was expecting the shape of the mask, being so large, to make it hard to get comfortable but that is so not the case here. I can barely notice its presence and I fall asleep much faster these days.<br /><br />EDIT (9/20/2013): I traveled overseas this summer and left it somewhere. Purchasing a new one of these was one of the first things I had to do when I came home (it arrived quickly). I will continue buying this product in particular over other brands as it has never failed to do an outstanding job.
  1305. This is just awesome. You might be like \\"Man, $25 is a lot to pay for just a piece of fabric over my face...\\" Well don't think that. It kind of is, but you've probably tried one of those dollar store eye masks or a bandanna or something like me. They just fall off at night, don't breathe quite right, and you wake up with it around your neck or on the floor or flung across the room. This mask will not do any of that. It'll sit tight all night long, blocking out that obnoxious moon light or the awful streetlamp right outside of your window. Does your neighbor shine a flood light directly into your window? Get this to avoid speaking to the inconsiderate jerk. Scared of waking up in the middle of the night with the feeling that 'something' is watching you? Get this and you'll wake up and see nothing and go back to sleep peacefully. Remember, if you can't see it, it can't see you.
