My problem with it is that to have it on securely it is tight across the eyes. I don't usually keep it on all night just while hubby watches tv but I do know pressure on your eyes can cause temporary blurry vision. Second problem I have is that it is so thick across the back of my head with two layers of padding and the strips of Velcro making kind of a hard place in the center I find it uncomfortable to sleep with it secured. If I move position in bed I usually have to readjust the mask secured or not. I do like how well it blocks light for me and I like that it covers my ears because I have a thing about sleeping without my ears covered lol. But I don't think it is worth the price. I gave 3 stars instead of only two because I do not have all the problems some have experienced but I do have some issues with it.

Like I said, I was highly skeptical before trying the Sleep Master Mask but now I've recommended it to friends, work colleagues, and family - those that have tried it like it if not love it!!
  1387. I've bought and tried numerous eye masks to block out the light on planes and in the bedroom. I've tried the cheap, throw-away versions, I've tried the expensive ones.   1407. I have had many sleep masks over the years, and this one is by far the BEST one I have ever used! Many of the over the counter ones are garbage, and basically consumable goods. This one, unlike many of the cheap variety has no low-grade elastic bands, that will just eventually stretch out and disintegrate over time. The Sleep Master uses velcro, which is easily adjustable to fit anyone's head. The satiny material feels spa grade to me. The size of the face mask portion is larger than any that I have seen/used, and completely 100% blocks out any light. I like the fact that the band can fit over your ears, which blocks out most annoying sounds, but still enables me to hear the baby monitor in my four month old's room, and relaxing white noise, like the fan I have going when I sleep. If you want more sound blocked out, the company also sent out a set of foam ear plugs which would definitely aide in noise reduction for sleep, or when your wife wants to talk to you about a \\"honey do\\" list. I read a few reviews about this product, and some of the low ratings make no sense to me. Complaining about a tag and having to cut it off? Why not just reverse the mask so the tag is out of the way? It is the exact same on both sides... Complaining of the mask being thicker in the back? Really? I never noticed it, plus, most products are created with the majority in masses when produced. Since the majority of people are side sleepers, this issue would only affect a few, and I have woken up in the morning some days on my back, and have NEVER noticed and discomfort of any kind.<br /><br />I have NO cons for this product, merely two small suggestions. One, would be perhaps an option of a wider or deeper nose groove, for people with large noses like myself, and two, though it may not be cost effective, would be a way to make the areas that go over the eyes more of a cupped, egg shape, so the product is not pressed right up against your eye lids if you want to wear it tight.<br /><br />Buy it! Try it! Love it as I do!

  1420. I am allergic to some molds. After about 4 days of wearing this mask, I started waking up with a stuffy nose. When I stopped wearing the mask, the stuffy nose went away. Very few sleep masks list the materials they are made from or provide washing instructions. I like the [[ASIN:B000CCI4YU Sweet Dreams Contoured Sleep Mask with Earplugs and Travel Pouch - Black]] because they list the materials: \\"closed cell foam and nylon that is washable and quick drying.\\" I did some research on the internet and found that while most foam does harbor mold, inside where it can't be seen, closed cell foam should not. I don't keep my eyes closed all night, so I sometimes woke with very dry, uncomfortable eyes when wearing this mask. It felt as if they were in contact with the mask. This mask also lets a little light in around the nose. Most of them do on me. The sound muffling feature (something sewn into the area over the ears) does not make much difference and makes the mask hotter to wear. The slippery fabric seems to make the mask slide around more than the others I have tried. I once woke to find it on the floor by the bed. I have to say, it was comfortable to sleep on my back, and the mask is very large so it covers a lot of my face. It would might be good for someone with a larger face and no mold allergies.

  1436. I've been looking for an alternative sound reducer for sleeping or getting some quite time. I use ear plugs quite a bit but find them really uncomfortable. I've always been amazed there are no low profile, over ear noise reducers on the market. Believe me I've searched high an low.<br /><br />When I saw this sleep mask with it's claim to reduce noise I purchased it immediately. I had my doubts but for the money I didn't really care. Well the sound reducing claim is all but false. The over ear portion of the mask is nothing special, just the same material as the rest of the mask. No additional padding or foam to help increase sound reduction. I'm sure it reduces sound to some degree but no more than say wrapping a towel around your head.<br /><br />As for blocking light, the mask is one of the best I've tried. The main reason for this is the mask contacts your eyelids forcing you to keep your eyes closed. It also maintains contact with the rest of your face very well. Lots of people don't like contact with the eyes and if you're one of them this mask is not for you.<br /><br />Comfort wise I'm pretty happy with this mask. The Velcro on the back allows it to be adjusted just right. The material is satin type and very soft. The padding is pretty thick and might get a little warm on hot nights so keep the AC on. My only comfort issue is on the bridge of the nose. There is a stitched seam there and I noticed a little abrasion on my nose. A little adjustment helps but a little extra padding here would have been nice.<br /><br />All and all it's a very good sleep mask. They should drop the sound reducing feature from the description though since it seems a stretch at best. Would have been 5 stars if this weren't the case.

  1484. Pros:<br />- The fabric is soft.<br />- The mask wraps completely around the head, which is more comfortable than a thin piece of elastic like on some masks.<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />- High price<br /><br />- Doesn't block light completely -- light comes in around the nose, so you must be in a dark room or keep your eyes closed.<br /><br />- Lays flat against the eyes, so you're always aware of the mask pressing against your eyeballs. It's annoying at first, but you get somewhat used to it after a while.<br /><br />- The mask is very noisy. Because the fabric covers your ears, any movement AT ALL is related loudly right into your ears. It's like wearing headphones playing static whenever you move. If you lay flat on your back and don't move, it's OK. Note: if you don't mind wearing earplugs for sleeping, it might not be that bad.<br /><br />- Because of the slick material, the mask slides off the back of your head very easily. Any movement at all causes it to slide slide out of position. If you lay flat on your back and don't move at all, it's OK.<br /><br />Bottom Line: I read the positive reviews and thought this would be a great product. I was pretty disappointed and almost tossed it in the trash after 3 days of hating it. Now I use it from time to time, and it's OK, but not great.
  1485. This sleeping mask is very nice, but lacks Eye pillows, I don't like pressure on my eyes. I suppose most people would not mind this and give it a 5 but for me I give it a 3 thank you.
  1486. As three stars say - it's okay. I've been sleeping with a mask for probably close to 15 years and this one takes many nights to get used to. Because of it's wraparound design it tends to make me hot - I'm a very warm blooded person who likes to sleep in a cold environment because of my tendency to overheat during the night. This mask will probably be good during the winter months as opposed to the humid and hot summer nights.<br /><br />One feature I wish was better is the Velcro closing - it is just a 1/2 inch wide strip that you have to really try to get it on straight or just a portion of the long strip (which is good that the fastener is long) is attached. Also, unless you put it on tightly it will shift around if you are a sleeper that tends to toss around like me. This results in too much pressure on my eyes which I'm not used to.<br /><br />Another pro for this mask is the nice carrying case. Keeps it nicely tucked away from dust and cat hair.

  1529. I started wearing a mask when some neighbors moved in and they keep their outside light on all night long and it is about 5 feet away from my window. And it still comfortable, the askew velcro'ing makes no difference in how it feels, even when I sleep with my head straight up on the pillow (back sleeper).<br /><br />I do not mind that in the morning when my alarm wakes me, it is sometimes still on my head and sometimes it is not; because I am not woken by light in the morning but by my alarm. However, there should be an invention which stops it from falling behind the bed! :-) I was missing it for one night; thought my cat might have dragged it off somewhere (because she is a collector or could be getting me back for scaring the daylights out of her with the velcro sound - lol) but it had just fallen behind head of the bed (we do not have a solid headboard) and I was searching for it, all worried I had lost it for good. I found some better than others and tried all the ones with the highest ratings. Brookstone eye masks were the best ones I could find; that is until I tried The Sleep Master sleep mask. It is almost perfect. The material is soft and envelopes your eyes and head in a cloud like feeling. I feel instantly relaxed and sleepy when I put it on. It is lightweight and does not feel hot. The only thing that may bother some people is that it lays directly on your eyes.... I found if I loosen the mask a little, it does not compress the eyes. I just love this mask. Sweet Dreams!
  1558. I bought this sleep mask based on the reviews and was very excited to try it because I work graveyard and must sleep during the day. When I finally did wear it to sleep, I found that the material made my head feel hot (This was in the winter!) and damp. The eye mask still lets some light in and overall the thickness of it made it uncomfortable to sleep on my back which I normally do. I would not recommend this product to anyone. I wish I could return it but it's been too long since I ordered it and now it's probably too late. Oh well. Lesson learned. My cheap novelty hello kitty eye mask works a hell of a lot better and is much more comfortable to wear.

  1564. This is the best sleep mask I have found so far and I have tried several.<br /><br />It is well made (nice materials, no Chinese stuff), blocks light and it is the only one I found that can be worn comfortably by side sleepers, without any risk of displacing the mask during sleep. The only thing I dont like is the silky texture, but It is well made and will please whoever likes silk (I dont). Still a 5 stars.<br /><br />Sounds silly but there are no instructions and I thought it wasn't needed, but after reading a tip from another customer here I found that the proper way to use it is not over the ears like other masks, but actually as loose as possible and almost under the ears (with strap ends towards the back of the neck). After following this tip I cant even feel the mask and I never lost it.
  1565. Thick, well padded, and covered in a satin like fabric, this covers your eyes and head pretty well. Little to no light leaks. It is a bit tight on my large head, but does fit properly. However, since it closes with hook-n-loop (Velcro) it can catch your hair, if it's long.

  1590. I have damage to a blinking muscle that causes my eye to open up once I enter deep sleep. I have been to so many doctors and they tell me to tape my eye shut. Try taping your eye shut and peel off the tape in the morning. Even with the most gentle tape it's a nightmare. I've been told to use Saran wrap, which will leave weird wrinkles around my eyes the next day. I've been told to use a dry eye 'goggles' (they look like motorcycle goggles) but they leave deep marks in my lower eyelid the next day. I've tried so many different masks, so far this is the best one. The only complaint is if I put in on tight it will cause me eye pain, but if too loose it will drift upwards during the night. But with the long flaps it usually manages to cover my eye enough to do the job. I dinged star for the inability to get a stable snug fit. I wish I could design one, I know exactly how to make it perfect. Two connections in the back instead of one, with one over the ear and one under the ear. I just gave myself the ides to alter one of them (I bought four) and see if it works better! I combine this mask with one of the preservative free eye gels. FWIW I referred this to a friend who just has sleeping problems, not a medical problem like I have, and she finds it covers too much of her face and it makes her hot. I don't have that problem.<br /><br />If anyone out there has a better solution I'd love to hear from you!<br /><br />EDIT: I figured out how to make this mask PERFECT. I cut it into 2 tabs in the back and then sew on Velcro to each strap. this way one strap is over the ear, the other under. It is the absolute PERFECT mask that doesn't leave marks on my face and doesn't budge all night. Even without the tweaks it's the best sleep mask out there.

  1606. This used to be my favorite sleep mask, after trying three other highly-rated sleep masks here on Amazon. It blocked the most light, while also being comfortable to wear.<br /><br />However, after wearing it for three years, I noticed a flaw: the 'ear flaps' (the wide bit of cloth that wraps around your ears to velcro the mask together behind your head) can cause ear pain if it's on too tight; yet the mask needs to be really night to block out all the light. I have big ears, and sleep with earplugs, which exacerbated the problem, but there would be many mornings, and sometimes whole weeks, where my ears would be sore.<br /><br />Earlier this year, I lost my Sleep Master mask, and bought a new one, along with a [[ASIN:B007ZFN1FY Bucky Luggage 40 Blinks Ultralight Sleep Mask]] and a [[ASIN:B000FFSWAU Bucky Shades Sleep Mask With Earplugs]]. I found that the Sleep Master had improved since I bought my original three years ago, removing a stiff cardboard insert in the ear flaps, making it more comfortable to wear at night. However, I found both Bucky sleep masks blocked more light, and the Bucky Shades sleep mask was just as comfortable as the Sleep Master, while the 40 Blinks was even more comfortable than either.<br /><br />So this isn't a bad sleep mask by any means -- I used it for three years, and happily bought a new one when it went missing. However, I can no longer say it's the best.
  1607. This mask is remarkably comfortable. It's large and pretty-much blocks out all light. It covers your ears, so sound is muffled.   1612. I read some of the other reviews and thought I'd give this mask a try - I'm glad I did. This is the best mask I've used. I have sleep apnea and use a CPAP. The sides are stiffer, but this (I assume) is by design to help the mask block out noise. It is very soft and comfortable - I hardly know I'm wearing it.<br /><br />I highly recommend this mask. I really value my sleep and this mask does a great job of making it easier to fall asleep, stay asleep and wake rested.<br /><br />A quick note to respond to some of the negative reviews:<br />- &#34;Bulky in the back&#34; (back sleepers, which I am one): pull it a little lower in the back, it will cover your ears and you won't have the fastening sitting directly on the back of your head.<br /><br />- Velcro rubs on the pillow: Undo the velcro, and turn it inside out so the loop part of the velcro is outside.<br /><br />FYI - my standards for a 5 star rating:<br />5 Star Requirements<br />- Price point must be reasonable (I'd expect a $100 sleep mask to be great)<br />- Must hold up to daily use with no (or very few) issues<br />- Must be easy to use, or set up (e.g., I don't have to sing while standing on one leg to get it to work)<br />- Must perform as advertised (none of this &#34;your experience may vary&#34; crap)<br />- Must have a bonus feature I find valuable

I'll definitely get more
  1636. This is one of the best investments of my life.<br /><br />I am a truck driver, and my truck does have curtains, but very often the only problem in getting to sleep would be one parking lot light hitting me right in the face. This mask nullifies lights light that, allowing me to feel like I am in a 95% dark room. I love it!<br /><br />It is PERFECTLY comfortable—I stop feeling it a second after I put it on. It also covers the ears so it deadens noise somewhat.<br /><br />Very well made. It does not have a sown-on strap; the mask is one piece with a velcro fastener, so it is infinitely (easily) adjustable and not going to wear out.<br /><br />Easy to wash, also.<br /><br />Worth every penny. I will probably buy another.
  1637. For a cool night this works fine. shield totaly from the light and offer enough muff for the ears. Do consider feeling the extra pading while sleeping on it. I sleep on a contour pillow and this kind of change the contour I am sleeping on. Also, it gets pretty warm on a summer night.
  1638. Prior to this sleep mask, I was using the [[ASIN:B0027OUUFW Tempur-Pedic Sleep Mask]] (~$40) which does work very well and is quite comfortable, but the velcro portion really gets tangled in long hair which does not work for me.<br /><br />THIS mask is very light, provides good coverage (not quite as complete at blocking out light as my prior mask, but much better at blocking out sound)... and the velcro area is small enough and sewn in carefully enough that it does not get tangled in my hair as I toss and turn. This holds true even when I'm wearing large sleep rollers. Seriously. I wish someone would come out with a really great sleep mask that didn't need velcro, but until then this will do. One word of warning if you are hard to wake - this mask does muffle sound quite well. You may want to either secure it a bit loose or put the alarm closer to you.

  1645. I've tried several different sleep masks, and for a few common reasons, they have all fallen short. Some aren't of a high enough build quality to last more than a few months. Others pull at your hair with elastic bands or constantly slip off the top of your eyes, causing light to shine in and awaken you when you're trying to sleep in. Others just don't fit well.<br /><br />The Sleep Master seems to resolve those issues. While it's a little bit more expensive, I think the additional sum is worth the cost. First, though I've only been using it for about two months, the materials and build quality seem like they will last longer than the other masks I've bought on Amazon; those only lasted about three to six months of nightly use, at which point elastic bans started fraying and liners started pulling off. The material is very soft, so unless you're allergic to it, it should not irritate your skin or cause you to itch. The large shape extends well below the eye, permitting the mask to move a bit more without exposing your eyes to light, and it seems better at accommodating a wider range of nose shapes and sizes than the others I've tried.<br /><br />If I had to cite a drawback, it's that the way the mask's Velcro straps in back, it makes a bit of a bump that can be uncomfortable to sleep on if you have a firmer pillow and sleep on your back. Overall, though, I've been very satisfied with this latest mask, which I pair with ear plugs for a good night's rest in heart of a busy city. For a light sleeper, this combination is a Godsend.

  1721. I decided to purchase the Sleep Master Sleep Mask because my partner would stay up later than I would and keep the light on to use his iPad in the bedroom.<br /><br />The product itself feels great. The satin that is used it very high quality and feels cool when first placed on your face. I usually run hot in bed, regardless of the time of year. I need a fan and will always have the sheets kicked off. I was worried that I would be sweating wearing the mask but I never had a problem.<br /><br />This is my first sleep mask ever. I read reviews of people complaining that they can see light in the nose area of the mask. I noticed the same thing when I tried it on but it makes no difference whatsoever on the overall light reduction. The small amount of light can only be seen if you open your eyes and look at it. When closed, it is complete darkness.<br /><br />While sleeping, it has never come off and keeps a great hold. You are able to adjust the tightness of the mask to your level of satisfaction.<br /><br />I usually hand wash the mask once every 2 weeks if not once a week. My masks nose area will have a little grease from my nose and that will build up after a week and leave an awkward smell. So once a week is usually fine. Takes about a day to dry and after that you are back in business.<br /><br />Would recommend to anyone looking for a Sleep Mask.
  1722. I never wore a sleep mask before but this is very comfortable, and I enjoy using it. I find it quite satisfactory and I am sure you will, too, should you choose to purchase it.
  1723. The mask is made of good quality and is thick enough that it keeps out all light. It feels nice on the face and wraps around the ears to reduce noise a little bit. It's a winner.
  1724. I bought this sleep mask to help me sleep during the day while working midnights. We have a skylight in our bedroom, so it is very bright during the day. This mask blocks most (but not all) light, which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. I am able to successfully sleep during the day with this use of this mask and the included ear plugs. It is also very soft and comfortable - I don't notice it on my face or my head.
  1725. Really blocks out the sunlight and it's very comfortable. I wear it every night. The shape also keeps well while traveling.
  1726. I bought this for my wife who is very sensitive to any light while she is trying to sleep. She loves it. The mask is very comfortable and blocks out the light exactly as it should. It is very soft and has a wide band that fastens in the back which is perfect. The best mask by far that we have tried.
  1727. My Wife loves it and can wear it through the night. I previously purchased the Tempurpedic model thinking it was the best, but it doesn't work well if you are a side sleeper. Also the Tempurpedic model applies pressure on your nasal cavities which can be uncomfortable. The Tempurpedic model might block out more light, but the sleep master is more comfortable and now that my wife has both, she hasn't used the tempurpedic model.<br /><br />Strap is durable. This will last much longer than other sleep masks.
  1728. After reading about it on the wire cutter (http://thewirecutter.com/reviews/travel-guide/#eye-mask) I was convinced this was the best. I even spoke to an owner of the company in Las Vegas and she was a very nice person. This mask beautifully locks out almost all light, and is quite comfortable. However, the satin like material that is used tends to fray very easily. Within a month of owning, little strands of fibre have frayed in the nose area. This does not degrade the integrity, but the little strands tickling your nose is unbearable. It's like someone sticking a feather in your ear, nostrils, or other sensitive area while you're trying to sleep. I found running a lighter helps to burn off the frayed strands easily, but was not expecting this issue.
  1729. This sleep mask is much more useful and comfortable than ones I've used in the past. It fully covers your eyes without feeling obstructive. Would highly recommend.
  1730. We live in AZ where the sun begins it's morning climb very early in the summer. I have always been one to rise with the sun, but sometimes I'd like to sleep past 5:30 AM! This sleep mask is just wonderful, I can finally sleep past sunrise, it is very comfortable and keeps out the light. I love the wide coverage at the sides and no nagging elastic strap! Very satisfied customer.
  1731. This sleep mask is so much more than I expected. I thought I was getting some generic mask, I didn't realize how much I actually paid for it until the next day. But I couldn't have been more satisfied when it arrived!
  1732. I work nights and sleep into the morning. Very comfortable. This blocks out most light. some will come in through the nose a little. Needs washing after a while.
  1733. I love this mask! I currently work nights and sleep during the day and it's like having a wonderful pillow for my eyeballs!
  1734. It doesn't block out as much noise as I had hoped, but it helps 😊
  1735. Bought this sleep mask after seeing all the highly rated reviews. I couldn't have been more disapointed after using it. Puts lots of pressure on your eyes (which is bad for them) and retains much more heat than imagined. Also, you have to keep up with cleaning because the satin material absorbs lots of oil from you face and can cause you to breakout. You can actually see the dark area where all the oils from your face and forehead absorb into the mask. The area that I was most disapointed was that it did a poor job at keeping out light. The slit for your nose bends which allows for light to pass through. If you are looking you a mask that blocks out all light this is not the mask for you. One positive is that it wraps around your ears to help diminish sound, however keep in mind that it is very bulky.
  1736. I purchased this product to help me sleep during the day.<br />I work graveyard and don't normally get to bed until 8AM. Living in the southwest the suns comes pretty early.<br /><br />I purchased this product to see if it will help me go and stay asleep, no matter how bright the sun is.   1737. It works fairly well but it does move during the night. You cannot put it on tight enough to stop it from moving if you are a restless sleeper. Otherwise it's fine
  1738. EDIT: I'm keeping my original comments intact for those that initially have trouble as I did but see below for a correction.<br /><br />Original review:<br />------------------------<br />I have had this eye mask on my Amazon Wishlist for what seems like forever and this past Christmas, my girlfriend finally got it for me.<br /><br />My initial impression was that it is the most comfortable eye mask i have ever used and the construction is top-notch.<br /><br />Then, after a few uses, I discovered it's fatal flaw, which makes it ultimately unusable: adjusting the mask snug enough so that it doesn't move around or slip off my head during sleep causes the mask to apply a constant, gentle pressure directly on my eyes. It's not painful but after a full night's sleep with the mask, I would wake up with blurred vision that would take between 1-3 hours to dissipate. I experimented a few nights to determine if I was maybe doing something wrong but the issue is persistent or the mask is so loose it falls off. I have an older eyemask with raised areas over the eye sockets and I even tried wearing that under this eye mask which seems to alleviate the issue but makes the mask more prone to slip out of place and is hotter, of course. In the end, I decided it was more trouble than it's worth.<br /><br />I emailed the manufacturer inquiring on this issue immediately after realizing what was happening and it's been a few weeks and I have yet to hear back and frankly, don't expect to at this point which makes for a poor service experience.<br /><br />I have no idea if this issue could possibly cause permanent eye damage or reduced vision quality but I'm not risking it. Which is a shame because as I stated before, it is the most comfortable eye mask I've ever used ... so comfortable, you don't even notice it's messing up your eyes.<br />---------------------------<br /><br />EDIT: After initially posting my review, the company reached out to me to acknowledge my concerns andprovided outstanding customer service, as well as being very apologetic that my initial contact to them through their website was not responded to in a timely fashion. They offered some wearing suggestions that I followed that corrected my issues. I wish there had been a small slip of paper included with the mask that provided the proper wearing instructions or that it was posted on their website somewhere as I found the recommendations to be counter-intuitive. With other typical masks I've used previously there are one or two elastic bands that go over or around your ears; even with two bands I'd typically wear both bands a bit high above the ears as to not have the elastic dig into the top of my ears while I slept and with ones that are adjustable I'd typically have them pretty snug as to not slip off during the night. I'd never had similar issues with other masks but I prefer ones with raised cups over the eyes, it's just a shame that most other masks are made of cheap material (especially the elastic they all seem to have that wears out in a matter of weeks). As a matter of habit, I wore this sleep mask the same way as others: high and snug. That is the wrong way to wear this mask. The company suggested to me to wear with the back of the mask at the base of my skull and a bit loose. Now, I had tried loosening the mask on my own as I mentioned above but even wearing directly over the ears, it would slip off. Wearing it lower as recommended resolved the issues I was having with blurriness of my vision but felt weird at first until I adjusted to it. At the right size for my head to avoid the issue, it feels too loose but does not slip off or move around my head during the night. I'm still adjusting to it but I'm happy to report that the blurriness is (mostly) gone. I've still had a couple of incidents with very minor blurriness but really only noticeable when I reading text on a computer screen (which is crucial for what I do for a living) and is now gonewithin a few minutes after waking up. I'm assuming that with continued use I'll acclimate to the mask better and that I'm still a bit hypercritical at this point having initially had such an alarming experience; those that don't have to look at a computer screen or read a good bit of text first thing in the morning would likely never notice such an issue, so long as they are wearing the mask correctly.<br /><br />I highly urge the company to provide instructions with the masks or at least posted on their website going forward ... even if only a small handful of customers have similar issues such as myself, it's a very jarring experience to have your eyesight affected. As my initial review even stated, it's an immensely comfortable mask and I'm delighted that now I can wear it. The company is a small family owned business so I know it may not be feasible to start putting instructions in with their existing inventory but I hope to see something on their website at least and that they take my suggestion to heart for future production.<br /><br />Now, I cannot emphasize enough that if my initial review or the handful of other similar negative reviews have put you off purchasing one, just do it. Per the company's website itself and the product description here, they do offer a 30 day money back guarantee so you have nothing to lose. If you've used one before and were disappointed and had a similar experience as I did initially, take another look.
  1739. I'm a really restless, light sleeper and get startled out of sleep at any small noise, and can't fall asleep if there is any light on my eyes. This is especially a problem since I've been working nights. I've tried all kinds of ear plugs and masks, but I really don't like the feeling of having something jammed in my ear (plus there was a bad experience with a piece of silicone ear plug getting caught in my ear canal and causing an infection!). This mask is the perfect solution to block out light and muffle sound without having to introduce foreign objects into one's body.<br /><br />I do take off one star because the mask sits directly over the eyes, unlike contoured sleep masks. I find contoured sleep masks that allow for free eye movement are less irritating to eyes that suffer from allergies.

If you tie a bandanna over your head, you will get to experience the same sound muffling technology. I can hear my partner breathing next to me while wearing this. In fact, this brings up the only negative I see in this product. Anything that is touching the blindfold (like a blanket) will rub against it when you move (or when the blankets move as you breath) and the rubbing sound is conducted by the smooth material right into your ears. I've found the superior darkness and comfort outweigh this minor inconvenience, but they could probably fix it by using a different material over the ears. Something like micro-fleece.

  1760. The mask is made of very soft taffeta material, and secures easily. It's super soft and isn't easily felt once secured. As it also wraps the ears, some sound insulation results, but tis does not prevent the use of headphones if one chooses to use when resting of sleeping. Almost everything is &#34;right&#34; about this product, so I will just detail the only shortcomings I have found:<br />1. The mask material is not completely opaque. When trying to sleep in a windowed area, the thing does pass light, even though the light must penetrate two layers of fabric and the filling material. Wish the interior paddling/filler was completely opaque, but at least the chosen materials are breathable;<br />2. The material is absorbent. This means natural oils from the face will discolor the mask. Keeping it clean only requires a light soak and scrub, then air drying. Don't know to how remedy this; am glad coated facing fabric was not used, as it's generally toxic. I now wash my face before sleeping, and this cuts down on required washing.<br /><br />Am happy with this purchase, and hope the company continues to improve the thing!

This is the solution.<br /><br />I searched high and low for a larger sleep mask but all of the retail places I tried carried the same brands and styles. When I found this one, I was worried by the complaints about needing extra velcro (how big is that guy's head? geesh!) but not any more.<br /><br />It fits around my big noggin' and stays in place just fine as I switch from back to side sleeping throughout the night.<br /><br />Frankly, they could have charged more for this and I still would have felt like I got a good value.   1886. With me and my hubby on often differing sleep schedules, and my brother living with us on an even more radically different schedule, I was getting desperate for a good night's sleep. Lights turned on and off, music, or TVs or computers in other rooms, casual talking, noises outside, quarreling pets - all had the potential to disturb my sleep and often did.<br /><br />The other sleep masks I had tried either didn't stay put or didn't block the light well enough. None helped with the noise.<br /><br />This TOTALLY blocks the light for me. It stays put all night. It feels so amazing on the skin. The supposed noise canceling perk is almost too minor to even be worth mentioning; however, this comes with a pair of ear plugs. Ear plugs in the past always came out, but the way the mask is designed, covering your ears, keeps the ear plugs in place.<br /><br />Boy, oh boy! Add those ear plugs and - BAM! - perfect, solid, totally uninterrupted snoozing...at least until the alarm sounds off (which I can still hear just well enough not to sleep through it, even with the ear plugs).<br /><br />The only down sides are figuring out how snug a fit you need to be comfortable, and sometimes the flaps in the back can dig a little into the skull. You have to find the right tightness for you and where to best wrap the flaps around the back of your head so as not to dig in. That took about 4 days for me but now I am good. A minor disappointment is the lack of options for colors. Blue is beautiful, but I guess I like more variety. Like I said, minor.<br /><br />Husband is asking me to get one for him, too, now!   1889. QUALITY - This product is made of very high quality materials. The silky fabric stays fairly cool even in a somewhat warm room.<br /><br />PRICE - Considering the quality of the product, the price is reasonable.<br /><br />DURABILITY - The mask is well made and I expect it to hold up for a long time.<br /><br />DESIGN & FIT - Here's where this product gets 4 stars instead of 5. It's likely the best sleep mask I've ever had, but it's not perfect. Every face is different, so it's sure to be perfect for someone. That being said, the closure on the back can be attached in a few configurations to tighten or loosen the mask. In my experience, the tighter the mask is, the better the light blockage but the less comfortable the mask due to too much pressure on my eyelids. It takes some experimenting to get the most comfortable fit, and it takes adjustment to get accustomed to your face being covered.<br /><br />Despite the thinness of the material, I'd venture to say the mask blocks out over 99% of light. The only light that gets in is around the nose, and that’s what requires so much adjustment.<br /><br />EARPLUGS - The earplugs that came with the mask weren't bad, but I only tried them on for a few minutes, as I wear &#34;The World's Finest Earplug&#34; (a customizable earplug also available on Amazon). One of the nice things about the mask is that it helps keep earplugs in and adds another (if basically superficial) layer of noise blocking.<br /><br />OVERALL - I am very happy with this product. It helps me get more quality sleep despite lights being turned off and on frequently during my sleep time (horrible roommates - don't ask).
  1890. I have had problems getting to sleep and staying asleep for years. I used Benadryl for 20 years to help me sleep, and then it stopped working. I tried herbal teas, Valerian root, melatonin, and even Ambien, which made me suicidal almost as soon as I started taking it. None of this stuff worked very well, and I just don't like taking any drugs or herbs if I don't have to. When I reached the age of menopause recently it got even worse, I was going for days with little sleep and I was freaking desperate! I read about this Sleep Master sleep mask with ear plugs on a Food Renegade email, and although I had tried sleep masks before, when I saw that it didn't have an elastic band to keep it on (that hurt my head) and that it helps to keep the ear plugs in, I thought what have I got to lose? I bought this in February of 2013 and I have slept better in those few months than I have in 20 years. I get to sleep faster and I stay asleep. I actually slept until 9:30 yesterday - which is just unheard of!! I don't like to sleep that late, but I must have needed it. I bought contoured ear plugs to go with this as the cylindrical ear plugs hurt my ears. Don't hesitate to buy this, it is amazing! Do I still have occasionally sleepless nights or restless nights? Yes, but they have been few and far between and this has been one of the most stressful times in my life. I am on medical disability, lost my job because of it, I have a family member who is seriously ill and have lots of worries about that and money worries, and I am still getting the best sleep in years.
